(Public Health Significance) Contamination and unclean equipment may increase risk of foodborne illness.

violations.observation: Inadequate facilities provided for hand washing. Handwash station is located at the far corner of the front area and not easily accessible to kitchen staff. violations.observation: Temperatures of the refrigeration unit storing potentially hazardous food items located near the kitchen entrance right by the cooking area, were consistently measured above the regulatory requirement of 4°C when measured using both a surface infrared thermometer and an internal probe thermometer at the time of inspection. (Public health significance)-Temperatures maintained above 4°C and below 60°C for more than 4 hours can lead to the growth of microorganisms in potentially hazardous foods. Maintaining proper cold holding (4°C or below) is critical to inhibit bacterial proliferation and ensure food safety thereby preventing potential food borne illnesses.
violations.corrective_action: Operator moved all food items to a functional refrigerator that maintains temperatures below 4°C. Operator must ensure that all refrigeration units used for storing potentially hazardous foods are always maintained at or below 4°C always. Monitor temperatures frequently throughout the day to ensure proper functioning is maintained.

violations.observation: Food items such as samosas, cabbage were left uncovered in the walk-in cooling unit located at the back end of the kitchen. A container of cut cabbage and a spice box were also observed uncovered on one of the prep tables. (Public health significance)- Storing food without proper covering can lead to contamination from other food items or debris. It also increases the risk of cross-contamination and exposure to pathogens, compromising food safety thereby potentially leading to foodborne illness.
violations.corrective_action: Operator covered all food items at the time of inspection. Operator must ensure that all food items are properly covered at all times to protect against contamination and maintain food safety.

violations.observation: No active sanitizer (chlorine) detected in sanitizer spray bottles. Test strips weren't available at the time of inspection. (Public Health Significance) Sanitizing solutions must be strong enough to destroy bacteria on surfaces to prevent the contamination of staff, clients or food in contact with the improperly cleaned/sanitized surface.
violations.corrective_action: Operator to order test strips to frequently monitor the concentration of the sanitizer spray. Operator refilled the sanitizer spray bottle and the sanitizer solution was of adequate concentration when tested with EHO's test strips. Operator must change sanitizing solutions as required to always maintain an effective concentration (chlorine-100ppm) or when visibly dirty.

violations.observation: Wiping cloths left on the counters between use. (Public Health significance) - Cloths once used can harbor and grow bacteria if left as used at room temperature.
violations.corrective_action: Operator was advised to store wiping cloths in a sanitizing solution of 200 ppm chlorine or use disposable paper towels.

violations.observation: Mice droppings were observed in the storage room. (Public Health Significance) Rodents and other pests may cross contaminate foods and surfaces or contaminate human food with feces and urine, carry parasites and other diseases. This leads to the contamination of food & food contact surfaces potentially causing foodborne illness.
violations.corrective_action: Operator must improve the general sanitation and cleanliness of the food premises. Operator to monitor for any pest activity in the food premises and work with the professional pest control company to address the issue. Mice droppings need to be thoroughly cleaned using bleach (1part bleach: 9 parts water). Wear proper gloves & mask to prevent aerosolization of the mice droppngs. Do not vacuum.

violations.description: Conditions observed that may allow entrance/harbouring/breeding of pests [s. 26(b),(c)]
violations.observation: Gaps were observed at the bottom of the two back doors. (Public health significance)- Unsealed gaps can allow the entry of pests such as rodents. Pests can contaminate food and food contact surfaces with pathogens, posing a significant risk to food safety potentially leading to foodborne illness.
violations.corrective_action: Operator must seal all gaps that could be potential entrances for pests into the food premises.

violations.description: Food premises not maintained in a sanitary condition [s. 17(1)]
violations.observation: Accumulation of grease and dirt were observed in the exhaust hood above the cooking area in the kitchen. Grease buildup was also observed between the vents in the hood. The buildup appeared to have developed over an extended period, indicating inadequate cleaning frequency. The hood is cleaned every 6 months professionally (ProVent) and weekly by the operator with the use of a degreaser. (Public health significance)- Grease, oil and dirt accumulation can attract pests and can create unsanitary environment, increasing the risk of cross-contamination thereby causing adverse health effects. It can also be a fire hazard due to the flammability of oil.
violations.corrective_action: Operator was advised to thoroughly clean the affected area by soaking it in a degreaser solution overnight & implement a more frequent cleaning schedule. Regular deep cleaning must be done to maintain sanitation and prevent grease & dirt from getting accumulated. Overall sanitation of the facility needs to be improved.

violations.observation: Potentially hazardous cold foods (curries, samosas, vegetable pakoras) stored at 10.2°C (internal temperature measured with a probe thermometer) in the walk-in cooler. All food items were in the cooler for more than 4 hours. All potentially hazardous foods must be stored at below 4°C or above 60°C - out of the danger zone to prevent bacterial growth and possibly food borne illness.
violations.corrective_action: Operator voluntarily discarded food items at the time of inspection. Operator to ensure that the walk-in cooler is not used for storage of potentially hazardous foods until it is able to maintain temperature under 4°C.

violations.observation: Pot of lentil curry kept stored on the floor beside walk-in fridge posing a risk of contamination due to near contact with floor surfaces and potential exposure to pests.
violations.corrective_action: Pot of lentil curry moved to storage area above the floor. Ensure that foods are stored at least 6" off the floor and protected from contamination.

violations.observation: Large build-up of food debris, grease, and grime in various areas of the restaurant. This can affect sanitation and affect pests.
violations.corrective_action: Regularly clean and sanitize all food contact surfaces, underneath and behind the equipment, and tools and equipment to prevent build up of dirt and debris. Ensure the general facility is cleaned and sanitized before the next follow-up visit.

violations.description: Conditions observed that may allow entrance/harbouring/breeding of pests [s. 26(b),(c)]
violations.observation: Observed that the back doors were left open at the time of inspection. Pests can enter the building easily when the door is open.
violations.corrective_action: Operator immediately shut down one of the doors while the other one was still seen open throughout the inspection. Install a screen door or leave the backdoor closed during operation.

violations.observation: Floor tiles were broken throughout the food premises which poses tripping hazard for the employees as well as risk of potential contamination of the food because of the inability to effectively clean and sanitize the floors.
violations.corrective_action: Operator to get the flooring replaced for the entire facility and to ensure that the flooring is made up of the materials that are easy to clean and disinfect.

violations.description: Items not required for food premises operation being stored on the premises [s. 18]
violations.observation: Many items not used in the restaurant operations stored in the back storage area. This is a potential nesting area for pest as the clutter makes it difficult to clean and sanitize
violations.corrective_action: Remove all items that are unrelated to the operation of the restaurant.

violations.observation: Pot of meat stew was kept at room temperature for approximately 4-5 hours as stated by operator. This is not an appropriate method of cooling potentially hazardous foods as this temperature provides an opportunity for bacterial growth/production of toxins that can result in foodborne illness.
violations.corrective_action: Meat stew was moved to walk-in cooler immediately. Ensure that potentially hazardous foods are cooled properly (from 60 C to 20 C within 4 hours, followed by 20 C to 4 C within 2 hours using refrigeration).

violations.observation: Crate of peeled onions kept stored on the floor beside walk-in fridge. The crate used did not provide adequate protection from contamination due to near contact with floor surfaces and potential exposure to pests.
violations.corrective_action: Crate of onions was moved to storage area above the floor. Ensure that foods are stored at least 6" off of the floor and protected from contamination.

violations.observation: Various fridge handles have significant build up of grease and residue. This may result in contamination of food and food contact surfaces with bacteria that can cause foodborne illness.
violations.corrective_action: Clean the indicated areas thoroughly. Ensure that cleaning is done on a regular basis to prevent build up of residue on high-touch surfaces.

violations.description: Employee lacks good personal hygiene, clean clothing and hair control [s. 21(1)]
violations.observation: Food handler staff observed patting down rice into small container with bare finger before serving directly to customers. Staff member did not wash hands before handling rice.
violations.corrective_action: Container of rice was discarded. Ensure that staff are practicing proper hygiene and limiting contamination of food during food handling procedures.

violations.observation: Potentially hazardous cold foods (cooked rice) stored at 10°C (external temperature). violations.corrective_action: Cooked rice was moved to working refrigeration units that maintain a temperature of 4°C or less, monitor and adjust the temperatures or have serviced, as required.

violations.observation: Foods were left uncovered and open to contamination. (Public Health significance) - Contamination of food from contact with objects, people, pests or chemicals can cause serious illness.
violations.corrective_action: Covered all foods with foodgrade saran wrap to protect from airborne contaminants, drips from raw foods, and contact with objects and staff.

violations.corrective_action: Operator to get the flooring replaced for the entire facility and to ensure that the flooring is made up of the materials that are easy to clean and disinfect.

violations.description: Food premises not maintained in a sanitary condition [s. 17(1)]
violations.observation: Heavy build-up of grease and food debris under and behind the equipment which could potentially become harbouring areas for pests and further contaminate the food, thus spreading foodborne illnesses to the public.

violations.observation: Dry food items not being used in the food premises were stored in the storage area.
violations.corrective_action: Operator to remove the food items from the facility that are no longer needed for food preparation on the food premises.

violations.corrective_action: Ensure Food grade plastic bag or wrap used to prevent any food contamination

violations.observation: Surface temperature for potentially hazardous food items in the open top cooler across the grill was measured at 11°C to 15°C. Another open top cooler at the pizza assembly station measured at temperature higher than 4°C. Operator said that they usually run out of food items in these inserts within 2 hours. Public Health Significance - All potentially hazardous foods must be stored at below 4°C or above 60°C - out of the danger zone to prevent bacterial growth and possibly food borne illness.
violations.corrective_action: Operator told to use time stickers or to somehow keep track of time period for which the food sits at temperature higher than 4°C. Ensure Potentially hazardous foods must be displayed or held for service above 4°C and below 60°C, for no more than 2 hours, before which time, they must be used, refrigerated or frozen.

violations.observation: Internal temperature for prep refrigerator units across from grill and bar was measured at 5.1 °C. Internal temperature of mash potatoes inside refrigerator was measured at 5.4 °C. Internal temperature for chopped lettuce and garlic stored at insert above was measured at 8.5°C and 11.9 °C respectively. Operator is aware of the issue and is working with refrigerator unit suppliers to resolve it. Currently, only small batches of food are kept inside the unit and the inserts above while the rest are stored in a functional walk-in cooler. Operator mentioned that they had implemented temporary corrective actions where ice would be used to cool food items down if temperature is measured above 4 °C. Refrigeration temperature should be maintained at least at 4 °C to prevent pathogens growth that could cause foodborne illness in potentially hazardous foods..
violations.corrective_action: Operator to continue current temporary corrective actions and work with suppliers to repair or replace the refrigeration units. Continue to ensure potentially hazardous foods are not stored in temperature danger zone for more than 4 hours.

violations.observation: Surface temperature for three food preparation refrigerator units located next to stoves and a chest cooler in the bar area was measured at 5°C to 8 °C. Surface temperature for cut salad ingredients and sauce stored in the pans above refrigeration units were measured at 6 °C to 10 °C. Operator indicate that they were aware of the refrigeration issue and is waiting on parts for repair. Currently, they only bring food from the functioning walk-in cooler in small batches and food would be discarded if they remained at uncontrolled temperatures for more than 4 hours. Temperature abused potentially hazardous food promotes the growth of unwanted microbials, increasing the risk of foodborne illnesses.
violations.corrective_action: Operator to repair or replace refrigeration unit as soon as possible. Continue current practice to only store small batches of food in these refrigerators, discard when items are stored at room temperature for over 4 hours and monitor refrigeration unit temperatures twice a day. Operator should have a method, such as labeling or a log, to track the time pans are removed from the cooler to ensure they do not exceed the 4 hour hold limit in room temperature.

violations.observation: Chlorine Chemical Dishwasher was not dispensing chlorine at the minimum required concentration of 50-100 ppm. Operator investigated the issue and learned that the sanitizer bucket feeding the machine was emptied. Inadequate sanitation of utensil does not reduce the microbial load to a safe levels on food contact surfaces, increasing the risk of foodborne illness.
violations.corrective_action: Operator replaced the empty bottle of chlorine sanitizer bucket with a new one during inspection. Operator to check sanitizer bucket regularly to ensure there were no empty buckets.

violations.observation: Gap that may potentially allow pest entray was noted on weather sweep of the back door. Small gaps can allow the potential entry of pest into the premises. These pest may carry harmful microbials that may contaminate food and equipment, increasing the risk of foodborne illness.
violations.corrective_action: Operator to replace door sweep.

violations.observation: Handwashing habits on premise were observed. One employee was washing hands with gloves on while another was washing hands without soap. Improper handwashing can cross-contaminate food with hazard that is being carried on employee's hand, increasing the risk of foodborne illnesses.
violations.corrective_action: Operator to educate employee on proper handwashing techniquies.

violations.observation: Wiping cloth left on the counters between use. (Public Health significance) - Cloths once used can harbor and grow bacteria if left as used at room temperature.
violations.corrective_action: Operator moved the wiping cloth from the counter top into the sanitizing solution of 200 ppm QUATs.

violations.observation: No active sanitizer detected in sanitizer containers. (Public Health Significance) Sanitizing solutions must be strong enough to destroy bacteria on surfaces to prevent the contamination of staff, clients or food on contact with the improperly cleaned surface.
violations.corrective_action: Operator changed sanitizing solutions to maintain an effective concentration 200 ppm QUAT. Use sanitizer test strips to ensure adequate sanitizer concentration.

violations.description: Refrigeration units and hot holding equipment lack accurate thermometers [s. 19(2)]
violations.observation: The facility did not have the thermometers in some of the refrigeration units. It is important to have working thermometers in the refrigeration units to ensure that the refrigeration units are meeting the regulatory requirement of maintaining temperature under 4°C at all times.
violations.corrective_action: Every operator of food premises must ensure that all refrigeration and hot holding equipment is equipped with a thermometer that is accurate within 1°C. These thermometers should be used to note the temperature readings when maintaining temperature logs.

violations.observation: Permit to operate not posted in the food premises. A recent decal sticker was displayed on another letter from Northern Health which was not an operating permit.
violations.corrective_action: Operator to have the permit to operate posted in a conspicuous location and ensure it has the valid decal posted on it.

violations.observation: Food items in the walk-in freezer were stored on the ground (Public Health significance) - Storage areas should have adequate shelving such that all materials, including food and food items, are maintained at a minimum of 15 cm (6 in.) off the floor on racks, shelves or pallets. Contamination of food from contact with objects, people, pests or chemicals can cause serious illness.
violations.corrective_action: Operator moved the bag of onions to another shelf that was off the ground. Ensure all food items are placed on racks and shelves which are at least 15 cm (6 in.) off the ground to prevent contamination of food as well as to allow for cleaning.

violations.observation: Mouse droppings were observed on the floor in the back storage room. Public Health Significance - Mice feces and flies can carry disease and contaminate food that can lead to foodborne illness.
violations.corrective_action: Operator to clean and sanitize areas with mouse droppings in the back storage area and contact the existing pest control company to put mice traps in the storage area to monitor and reduce pest activity.

violations.description: Permit not posted in a conspicuous location [s. 8(7)]
violations.observation: Permit to operate not posted in the food premises. A recent decal sticker was displayed on another letter from Northern Health which was not an operating permit.

violations.observation: Potentially hazardous cold foods such as cheese, sauces, meat products and chopped vegetables were stored at above 4°C. (Public Health significance) - All potentially hazardous foods must be stored at below 4°C or above 60°C - out of the danger zone to prevent bacterial growth and possibly food borne illness.
violations.corrective_action: Potentially hazardous cold foods stored for more that 4 hours in the refrigeration unit were dicarded and other food products were moved to a working refrigeration unit that could maintain a temperature of 4°C or less, monitor and adjust the temperatures or have serviced, as required.

violations.observation: Potentially hazardous hot foods (mashed potatoes) were stored at about 49°C internal temperature. violations.corrective_action: Operator immediately changed the settings on the hot-holding unit and turned up the temperature to over 60°C. Hot holding units must maintain a temperature of 60°C or more, monitor and adjust the temperatures, and have serviced as required.

violations.observation: Food items in the walk-in freezer as well as a bag of onions in the back storage area were stored on the ground  (Public Health significance) - Storage areas should have adequate shelving such that all materials, including food and food items, are maintained at a minimum of 15 cm (6 in.) off the floor on racks, shelves or pallets. Contamination of food from contact with objects, people, pests or chemicals can cause serious illness.
violations.corrective_action: Ensure all food items are placed on racks and shelves which are at least 15 cm (6 in.) off the ground to prevent contamination of food as well as to allow for cleaning.

violations.observation: Quats sanitizer concentration was noted at 50 ppm using the Quats test strips. Public health significance - Sanitizer solution should be available in the food premises to ensure adequate dishwashing and sanitizing. Sanitizing solutions must be strong enough (atleast 200 ppm for Quats) to destroy bacteria on surfaces to prevent the contamination of food on contact with the improperly cleaned surface.
violations.corrective_action: Operator immediately discarded the solution in the sanitizer bucket and prepared a fresh solution which was measured to be at 200 ppm.

violations.description: Food not thawed in an acceptable manner [s. 14(2)]
violations.observation: The operator was observed moving the raw meat from the dishwashing sink to a container. When asked, it was mentioned that the meat was thawing in the dishwashing sink. (Public Health Significance) Improper thawing procedure, foods thawed sitting in the dishwashing sink without any container can lead to cross-contamination of meat and potential spread of foodborne illnesses.
violations.corrective_action: Thaw foods completely submerged with its original sealed packaging or in a hermetically sealed container in cold potable water which should be changed every 30 minutes, or under running cold potable tap water.

violations.observation: Surface temperature for potentially hazardous food items in the refrigerator was measured at 10°C to 12 °C. Operator indicates that these food items were just put in the refrigerator. Public health significance - Temperature abused potentially hazardous food promotes the growth of unwanted microbials, increasing the risk of foodborne illnesses.
violations.corrective_action: To facilitate easy and faster cooleing, ffod should be divided into small batches and stoered in shallow pans. Operator to ensure all food containers are labelled for time when they were put in the cooler.

violations.observation: Fried chicken in the display hot holding unit was noted to be at 30°C-40°C. Operator mentioned that he only brings out small batches of food to the hot holding unit after they are cooked. Public health significance -  Temperature abused potentially hazardous food promotes the growth of unwanted microbials, increasing the risk of foodborne illnesses.
violations.corrective_action: Operator tohave a method, such as labeling or a log, to track the time food is cooked and placed in pans in the hot holding unit to ensure they do not exceed the 4 hour hold limit in temperature danger zone. Food to be discarded if it remained at uncontrolled temperatures for more than 4 hours.

violations.observation: Foods such as raw meat were left uncovered and open to contamination. (Public Health significance) - Contamination of food from contact with objects, people, pests or chemicals can cause serious illness.
violations.corrective_action: Staff was told to cover the food containers immediately. Cover or otherwise protect all foods from airborne contaminants, drips from raw foods, and contact with objects and staff.

violations.observation: Containers of food items were kept on the floor in the kitchen area posing a risk of contamination due to near contact with floor surfaces and potential exposure to pests.
violations.corrective_action: Staff moved the food containers to shelving units above the floor. Ensure that foods are stored at least 6" off the floor and protected from contamination.

violations.observation: Sanitizer wiping cloths left on the counters between use. (Public Health significance) - Cloths once used can harbor and grow bacteria if left as used at room temperature.
violations.corrective_action: Store wiping cloths in a sanitizing solution after each use.

violations.observation: Fried chicken was measured at 52°C. Public Health significance - All potentially hazardous foods must be stored at below 4°C or above 60°C - out of the danger zone to prevent bacterial growth and possibly food borne illness.
violations.corrective_action: Hot holding units must maintain a temperature of 60°C or more, monitor and adjust the temperatures, and have serviced as required. Hot held food stored below 60°C for more than 2 hours should be disposed.

violations.observation: Evidence of mice; droppings were noted in the downstairs storage area. Public Health significance - Rodents and other pests may cross contaminate foods and surfaces or contaminate human food with feces and urine, carry parasites and other diseases.
violations.corrective_action: Remove any pest attractants such as food and water, eliminate access to the building and routes they use inside. Trap and remove the pests. The use of a professional pest control operator is recommended. Clean and sanitize area where droppings are located and monitor situation.

violations.observation: Meat products were stored above 4°C in cooler by cooking line. Public Health significance - All potentially hazardous foods must be stored below 4°C or above 60°C - out of the danger zone to prevent bacterial growth and possibly food borne illness.
violations.corrective_action: Move potentially hazardous cold foods to working refrigeration units that maintain a temperature of 4°C or less, monitor and adjust the temperatures or have serviced, as required. Ensure that processed vegetables are labelled with the time they are removed from the cooler so that staff can monitor that they are not stored at ambient temperatures for more than 2 hours.

violations.observation: Some potentially hazardous hot foods were measured at 52°C. Public Health significance - All potentially hazardous foods must be stored at below 4°C or above 60°C - out of the danger zone to prevent bacterial growth and possibly food borne illness
violations.corrective_action: Hot holding units must maintain a temperature of 60°C or more, monitor and adjust the temperatures, and have serviced as required. Ensure that inserts are not overfilled and are regularly stirred so that the top portion of food within does not cool down below 60°C.

violations.observation: Foods were left uncovered and open to contamination nearby the handwash station, as well as below cleaning gloves on a rack. Public Health significance - Contamination of food from contact with objects, people, pests or chemicals can cause serious illness.
violations.corrective_action: Cover or otherwise protect all foods from airborne contaminants, drips from raw foods, and contact with objects and staff.

violations.observation: Evidence of mice; droppings were noted in the facility. Public Health significance - Rodents and other pests may cross contaminate foods and surfaces or contaminate human food with feces and urine, carry parasites and other diseases.
violations.corrective_action: Remove any pest attractants such as food and water, eliminate access to the building and routes they use inside. Trap and remove the pests. The use of a professional pest control operator is recommended. Clean and sanitize area where droppings are located and monitor situation.

violations.description: Food premises not maintained in a sanitary condition [s. 17(1)]
violations.observation: Some areas of the facility were noticeably dirty or greasy during the inspection, such as the storage rack and wall nearby the handwash station.
violations.corrective_action: Ensure that all areas of the facility are cleaned on a regular basis.

violations.observation: Fried chicken was measured at 52°C. Public Health significance - All potentially hazardous foods must be stored at below 4°C or above 60°C - out of the danger zone to prevent bacterial growth and possibly food borne illness
violations.corrective_action: Hot holding units must maintain a temperature of 60°C or more, monitor and adjust the temperatures, and have serviced as required. Hot held food stored below 60°C for more than 2 hours should be disposed.

violations.observation: Glove boxes and food processor inserts were stored with garlic and ginger. Observed raw chicken juices contaminating paper towel roll while staff was processing the chicken. Public Health significance - Glove boxes and equipment should be stored separately from food to prevent contamination. Contamination of paper towel roll with raw meat can lead to further contamination of food contact surfaces or food when the paper towel is next used.
violations.corrective_action: Store gloves and equipment separately from food. Ensure that paper towel is stored away from locations where it could become contaminated, and that if the roll is contaminated it should be disposed off.

violations.observation: Insufficient bleach detected in one of the sanitizer containers. Public Health significance - Sanitizing solutions must be strong enough to destroy bacteria on surfaces to prevent the contamination of staff, clients or food on contact with the improperly cleaned surface.
violations.corrective_action: Change sanitizing solutions as required to always maintain an effective concentration (100-200 ppm unscented bleach, 200-400 ppm QUAT) follow manufacturer's specifications)

violations.observation: Potentially hazardous cold foods were stored in the refrigeration unit that measured at 10°C. This cooler is located by the cooking line and stoves. Public Health significance - All cold potentially hazardous foods must be stored at 4°C or below and out of the danger zone to prevent bacterial growth and possibly food borne illness.
violations.corrective_action: Move potentially hazardous cold foods to working refrigeration units that maintain a temperature of 4°C or less. Fix the refrigeration unit as soon as possible.

violations.observation: For the shelving rack near the cooking line, used food equipment and trays were stored above freshly cooked food. These items have potential to contaminate the freshly cooked food below.
violations.corrective_action: Store cooked food above used equipment and trays. Do not store cooked food at the lowest shelves.

violations.observation: Wiping cloths were left on the counters and not in the sanitizer solution. 1 sanitizer bucket was located in the front service area and 0 sanitizer buckets were located in the back kitchen. Public Health significance - Cloths once used can harbor and grow bacteria if left as used at room temperature. Sanitizing step needs to be done after cleaning to kill off bacteria that may be on the surfaces,
violations.corrective_action: Store wiping cloths in a sanitizing solution of 100-200 ppm chlorine or 200-400 ppm QUATs. Mix according to the manufacturer's specifications. Food contact surfaces need to be cleaned with soap and water and then sanitized. In addition to the front service area, ensure that there also sanitizer buckets in the central kitchen prep area and back cooking area.

violations.observation: Disposable gloves were not changed sufficiently and staff were not washing hands enough to prevent contamination.
violations.corrective_action: Disposable gloves should only be used once and never washed. Handwashing must be done properly and as much as needed to prevent contamination.

violations.observation: Staff were cooling pork at room temperature, and the temperature was measured at 35°C after 2 hours. Public health significance - improper cooling can allow bacteria to grow within the food.
violations.corrective_action: Potentially hazardous foods that have been cooked must be cooled to 20°C or less within 2 hours, and then from 20°C to 4°C or less within 4 hours. If these temperature and time requirements are not met, the food must be discarded.

violations.observation: Prep refrigeration temperature was measured at 10°C. Processed vegetables are considered potentially hazardous food, and were observed to be stored at room temperature. Public Health significance - Processed vegetables are more likely to be contaminated with disease-causing bacteria, and therefore must be treated the same as raw meat to prevent bacterial growth and possibly food borne illness.
violations.corrective_action: Move potentially hazardous foods to working refrigeration units immediately--or discard the potentially hazardous foods in the defective cooler and have the unit serviced. Monitor and log temperatures regularly, adjust and have repaired as necessary to provide a temperature of 4° at all times.

violations.observation: Potentially hazardous hot foods are stored below 60°C. Black pepper beef internal temperature was measured at 52°C. Public Health significance - All potentially hazardous foods must be stored at below 4°C or above 60°C - out of the danger zone to prevent bacterial growth and possibly food borne illness
violations.corrective_action: All hot holding units must be routinely measured and maintain a temperature of 60°C or more, monitor and adjust the temperatures, and have serviced as required. Any food that has been stored below 60°C for less than 2 hours must be reheated to 74°C before serving to the public. If the food has been stored below 60°C for more than 2 hours it must be discarded.

violations.observation: Staff were skipping the sanitizing step while cleaning utensils and containers. Public Health significance - Sanitizing step must be done to destroy bacteria to prevent the contamination of staff, clients or food on contact with the improperly cleaned utensils and containers.
violations.corrective_action: All utensils, equipment, and food contact surfaces must be washed, rinsed, and sanitized after use and be in a sanitary manner for further use.

violations.observation: The facility is maintained in an unsanitary state. The accumulate of debris and dirt on the floor, equipment, and food contact surfaces can lead to contamination of food and foodborne illnesses.The availablity of water, food, poor sanition, and leaving food uncovered may encourages the breeding of pest in the facility and lead to foodborne illnesses.
violations.corrective_action: Operator must ensure that food is covered and the facility is maintained in sanitary condition. Deep cleaning of the facility including the food contact surfaces, floor, under equipment, and the walls must be done on a regular basis to minimize the availablity of water and food for pests.

violations.observation: Hand wash station in service area was obstructed with a bucket of sanitizer solution stored within the sink. Public Health significance - Hand washing is an important practice to ensure food are protected from cross contamination from other previously handled foods or contact surfaces.
violations.corrective_action: Ensure the hand wash station is accessible at all times and used only as a hand wash station whenever food is being prepared. Soap and paper towel in dispensers and hot and cold running water must be provided to facilitate proper hand washing.

violations.observation: Staff contaminated cooked food by touching it with gloves that were recently used to clean. Furthermore, as the handwash station in the serving area was obstructed during the inspection it is unlikely that staff are adequately washing their hands.  Public health significance - use of gloves can create a false sense of security when handling food, and can lead to contamination of food.
violations.corrective_action: Disposable gloves should only be used once and never washed. Reusable gloves should only be used for cleaning purposes, must be cleaned and sanitized on a regular basis, and must never be used to touch food. Handwashing must be done properly and as much as needed to prevent contamination.

violations.observation: An improvement in the sanitary condition of the facility, the establishment is still monitoring and working on the removal of mice. Intergrated Pest Control company Orkin working with the operator, in recent statements sanitary was a concern (Public Health Significance) Mice and other pests may cross contaminate foods and surfaces or contaminate human food with feces and urine, carry parasites and other diseases.
violations.corrective_action: Remove any pest attractants such as food and water, eliminate access to the building and routes they use inside. Orkin has put some traps and remove the pests. Clean and sanitize area where droppings are located and monitor situation.

violations.observation: Observed an improvement in the sanitary condition of the establishment, however, some build-up of grease was noticed on grime and floors and under equipments. Unsanitary conditions can lead to pest breeding conditions and pest can contaminate food and cause foodborne illnesses.
violations.corrective_action: Maintain a cleaning schedule and cleaning under equipments more often. Operator to maintain a constant cleaning of the facility.

violations.observation: Staff continue to use same set of gloves in between customers. It is important to change gloves regularly and to wash hands before putting a new set of gloves. Operator has communicated the risk associated with poor hand hygiene to all the staff. Poor hand hygiene can lead to contamination of food and cause foodborne illnesses.
violations.corrective_action: Ensure that gloves are not a substitute for hand washing practice and staff washes their hands regularily.

violations.observation: Processed vegetables are considered potentially hazardous food, and were observed to be stored at room temperature. (Public Health significance) - Processed vegetables are more likely to be contaminated with disease-causing bacteria, and therefore must be treated the same as raw meat to prevent bacterial growth and possibly food borne illness.
violations.corrective_action: Move processed vegetables to a working refrigeration units that maintain a temperature of 4°C or less, monitor and adjust the temperatures or have serviced, as required. Recommend that less vegetables are processed at one time.

violations.observation: Cooked foods and processed vegetables were left uncovered and at room temperature increasing the risk of contamination. (Public Health significance) - Contamination of food from contact with objects, people, pests or chemicals can cause serious illness.
violations.corrective_action: Cover or otherwise protect all foods from airborne or physical contaminants, and contact with objects and staff.

violations.observation: Observed inappropriate equipment (bowl) used as a scoop to obtain or move ingredients or product. (Public Health significance) - Scoop handles must be kept free from the product to prevent hand contact and contamination
violations.corrective_action: Use food safe scoops with handles in place of bowls to transfer ingredients/food.

violations.observation: Evidence of mice droppings were noted in the facility during the inspection. (Public Health Significance) Rodents and other pests may cross contaminate foods and surfaces or contaminate human food with feces and urine, carry parasites and other diseases.
violations.corrective_action: Remove any pest attractants such as food and water, eliminate access to the building and routes they use inside. Operator is working with an Intergrated Pest Management Orkin, in removal of pests, traps observed in the facility. Operator is yet to provide the three recent statements of visits from Orkin to Northern Health. The continuous use of a professional pest control operator is recommended. Clean and sanitize areas where droppings are located and monitor situation.

violations.observation: The facility is maintained in an unsanitary state. The accumulate of debris and dirt on the floor, under equipment, and the walls allows the breeding of pests. The availablity of water, food, poor sanition, and leaving food uncovered may encourages the breeding of pest in the facility and lead to foodborne illnesses.
violations.corrective_action: Operator must ensure that food is covered and the facility is maintained in sanitary condition. Deep cleaning of the facility including the floor, under equipment, and the walls must be done on a regular basis to minimize the availablity of water and food for pests.

violations.observation: During the inspection staff were observed coming off their breaks and going back onto the food preparation area or serving floor without washing their hands. Public Health Significance; hand washing with soap, warm running water and drying with paper towel is important to prevent the contamination of food that can lead to foodborne illnesses. Gloves are not a substitute for hand washing.
violations.corrective_action: Ensure staff washes their hands before handling food, before and after wearing gloves, after using the washroom, when returning from a break, after eating or handling raw food (e.g., raw chicken), or any activity or instance that could lead to contamination of hands (e.g., smoking, blowing nose, or cleaning floors). Gloves must be changed more frequently; recommended that they are not used at all.

violations.observation: Potentially hazardous hot foods, chicken in hot holding unit with an observed internal temperature of 45.5C in the serving area. (Public Health significance) - All potentially hazardous foods must be stored at below 4°C or above 60°C - out of the danger zone to prevent bacterial growth and possibly food borne illness.
violations.corrective_action: Operator increased the temperature of the unit. Hot holding units must maintain a temperature of 60°C or more, monitor and adjust the temperatures, and have serviced as required. Operator must check the temperature of food in the hot holding units every 2 hours and maintain logs.

violations.observation: Observed scoops left in ice bin/machines, ready to eat product. (Public Health Significance) Scoop storage exposes items to bare hand contact and potential contamination.
violations.corrective_action: Store scoops so that foods are not exposed to the handles or bare hand contact. Store food scoops in a sanitary manner and clean and sanitize them regularly.

violations.observation: Foods were left uncovered and open to contamination. The following foods were observed open during the time of inspection: chicken awaiting deep fry, chicken and vegetables in the cooler, cooked noodles open in the dry goods area and beneath the handwashing sink, and flour bag left open in the dry goods area (Public Health significance) - Contamination of food from contact with objects, people, pests or chemicals can cause serious illness.
violations.corrective_action: Ensure that food is cover or otherwise protect all foods from airborne contaminants, drips from raw foods, and contact with objects and staff

violations.observation: Raw meat is stored above ready to eat foods and produce. (Public Health significance) - Contact with and dripping fluids from raw foods can contaminate other items and lead to food borne illness.
violations.corrective_action: Store raw meats below and isolated from ready to eat items and produce.

violations.observation: Operator was unable to successfully describe the correct method for manual dishwashing, wash-rinse-sanitizing steps. One of the basin in a three compartmented sink was used to thaw chicken during the inspection and the other two of the basins used to wash and rinsed dishes, missing the sanitizing stage. (Public Health significance) - Equipments must be soaked in a sanitizing solution (minimum concentration of 100 parts per million (ppm) unscented bleach solution) after washing and rinsing to properly sanitize the equipments.
violations.corrective_action: Immediately initiate sanitizing of equipments/dishes providing a 100 ppm soak for 2 minutes for all dish ware. Ensure to follow the proper wash-rinse-sanitize of dish ware using the three-compartment sink method provided.

violations.observation: Evidence of a dead mice in the dry goods area; noted in the facility. (Public Health Significance) Rodents and other pests may cross contaminate foods and surfaces or contaminate human food with feces and urine, carry parasites and other diseases. Operator has a Intergrated Pest Control Management in place (Orkin which visit monthly, last visit in December 2022).
violations.corrective_action: Remove any pest attractants such as food and water, eliminate access to the building and routes they use inside. Trap and remove the pests. The use of a professional pest control operator is recommended. Clean and sanitize area where dead mice is located and monitor situation. Deep clean of the area and minimizing conditions that could promote the breeding of pest.

Public Health Significance - Unsanitary conditions can lead to cross-contamination and pest infestations, as well as serious foodborne illnesses.
violations.corrective_action: All surfaces in the food facility, including the walls, flooring, equipment, and food contact surfaces must be cleaned and sanitized on a regular basis.

violations.corrective_action: Floors that are subject to moisture must be maintained in good repair, easily cleanable, non-absorbent and durable. Ensure that the broken, chipped or peeling off vinyl flooring is replaced or repaired to meet the regulatory requirements.

violations.observation: Observed some surfaces are not sufficiently sealed or durable to facilitate regular cleaning and sanitizing (e.g., walk-in cooler storage areas and flooring). Operator stated that they have hired a contractor to refinish the walk-in cooler flooring. Public Health significance - Materials like raw wood will absorb juices and harbor and allow disease causing bacteria to grow. Proper materials and finishing is required to ensure adequate cleaning and sanitizing.
violations.corrective_action: Refinish or replace surfaces so that they are durable, smooth, and easily cleanable.

violations.observation: No active sanitizer detected in sanitizer containers. Public Health Significance - Sanitizing solutions must be strong enough to destroy bacteria on surfaces to prevent the contamination of staff, clients or food on contact with the improperly cleaned surface.
violations.corrective_action: Operator replaced sanitizing solutions during the inspection. Ensure that sanitizing solutions are replaced as required to always maintain an effective concentration (100-200 ppm bleach). Provided Operator test strips to monitor chlorine concentration until they can obtain them from their supplier.

violations.observation: Observed a hole in-between the back doors that could lead to entry of pests, as well as a significant amount of tape that mice could chew through on these doors. Operator stated that they had ordered weather stripping, and should have them installed in the next few days.
violations.corrective_action: Install proper weather-stripping on the back door to prevent entry of pests into the facility.

violations.observation: Observed some surfaces are not sufficiently sealed or durable to facilitate regular cleaning and sanitizing (e.g., walk-in cooler storage areas and flooring). Public Health significance - Materials like raw wood will absorb juices and harbor and allow disease causing bacteria to grow. Proper materials and finishing is required to ensure adequate cleaning and sanitizing..
violations.corrective_action: Refinish or replace surfaces so that they are durable, smooth, and easily cleanable.

violations.observation: Several beverage containers in bulk-packaging were stored on the ground in the walk-in cooler. Public Health significance - Contamination of food containers from contact with objects, people, pests, or chemicals can lead to foodborne illness.
violations.corrective_action: Ensure all foods, including beverages, are stored at least 15 cm off the floor to protect against contamination.

violations.observation: Food residue was observed on the deli slicers during the inspection. Operator provided logs stating that the deli slicers are cleaned and sanitized every 4 hours during operation. Also observed dirty oven gloves and a baking pan with excessive build-up on the outer layer in the baking area during the inspection. Public Health significance - Improperly cleaned and sanitized deli slicers have been linked to Listeria outbreaks. Dirty equipment and utensils can lead to cross-contamination and foodborne illness.
violations.corrective_action: Ensure that all equipment, utensils, and food contact surfaces are adequately cleaned & sanitized regularly so that they are maintained in a sanitary condition. Replace baking pans if they cannot be adequately cleaned and sanitized.

violations.observation: Observed the mat used to dry utensils was dirty, as well as cookware drying in the baking area nearby the sink dedicated for handwashing only. Operator stated the correct cleaning and sanitizing procedures, however they also provided misinformation during the inspection e.g., stated that their handwashed utensils dry in a few minutes. Public Health Significance - Utensils and equipment must be washed, rinsed, and then sanitized to destroy bacteria on surfaces to prevent the contamination of staff, clients, or food in contact with the improperly cleaned surfaces or utensils.
violations.corrective_action: All utensils, food contact surfaces, and equipment that come into direct contact with food must be washed, rinsed, and sanitized on a regular basis to ensure that they are maintained in a sanitary condition. The sink in the baking area must only be used as a dedicated handwash sink, and not used for cleaning and sanitizing utensils and cookware.

violations.corrective_action: Install proper weather-stripping on the back door to prevent entry of pests into the facility.

violations.observation: Bean spouts and portioned vegetables were stored inside the cooler uncovered. Contamination from shelves above may fall into these items, contaminating them and increasing the risk of foodborne illness.
violations.corrective_action: Operator moved portioned vegetable to a covered container. A lid was found for the bean sprot bucket and it was covered.

violations.observation: High temperature dishwasher was not able to achieve a final rinse temperature of 71°C at time of inspection. Temperature at the plate was measured at 67.5 °C. Inadequate sanitation of utensils could result in survival of pathogens on food contact surfaces, increasing the risk of foodborne illness.
violations.corrective_action: Operator had set up a manual sanitization container with chlorine at approximately 100ppm. They are waiting on new parts for their dishwasher.

violations.description: Equipment/utensils/food contact surfaces are not of suitable design/material [s. 16; s. 19]
violations.observation: A considerable amount of food is stored in non-foodgrade containers. Non-food grade containers may introduce plastic and other chemical contaminants into food. This was addressed during the last inspection in June 2023. Since then, the operator has ordered and replaced several non-foodgrade containers. Operator mentioned that supply and availability for food grade containers has been limited. Operator was able to order some, but not the full amount required for the restaurant. A good amount of supply is on back order. Operator will be replacing containers based on risk. For example. damaged/degraded containers and ones containing acidic food will go first.
violations.corrective_action: Replace all non-foodgrade containers that contain unpackaged food with approved foodgrade containers.

violations.observation: A remote inspection of this premises was conducted by phone on DD-MMM-YY. The operator completed a Food Premises Self-inspection Checklist and submitted this along with any requested supporting documents to the environmental health officer. An on-site inspection was not conducted by the environmental health officer.
violations.corrective_action: N/A

violations.observation: Foods stored in walk-in freezer were stored on the ground. Some foods (i.e., raw meat) stored above 15 cm (6 inches) were not covered and stored above prepared food. Additionally, some foods in the walk-in freezer were not stored in foodgrade containers. Some foods were also not covered and not stored in foodgrade containers inside the walk-in refrigerator. Public health significance: Food stored below 15 cm and in non-foodgrade containers is prone to biological, physical, and chemical contamination. Uncovered food may also lead to contamination from the environment or lead to cross-contamination of other stored foods. Consumption of contaminated food may lead to foodborne illnesses.
violations.corrective_action: Store all foods in the walk-in freezer and walk-in refrigerator at least 15 cm above ground, inside foodgrade containers if applicable, and have them kept covered.

violations.observation: Ventilation hood was noticeably stained with grease. Equipment (e.g., meat clever) used for processing raw meats were left unattended and soiled on food contact surfaces. Public health significance: Cross-contamination of food from equipment increase the risk of foodborne illnesses.
violations.corrective_action: Clean ventilation hood from grease and smoke stains. All equipment should be cleaned, sanitized, and dried after each use.

violations.observation: Non-food contact surfaces in the dry storage area were visibly filthy. Mice feces were found behind corners of shelves between the walls. Public health significance: Unsanitary conditions attract pests by providing source of food and harbourage for them. Dry food stored under unsanitary conditions may be contaminated by pests and increase the spread of harmful microorganisms that they carry. Consumption of these contaminated food may lead to serious foodborne diseases.
violations.corrective_action: Remove mice droppings using personal protective equipment and dispose carefully; clean and sanitize effected areas. Clean debris and food from floors, shelves, and all non-food contact surfaces in the dry storage/receiving area.

violations.observation:
-Observed food in the small kitchen refrigerator not covered. Covering food when storing it in the refrigerator helps prevent debris and/or pathogens from getting into the food which may cause foodborne illnesses when consumed.
-Observed Spring Rolls not covered under the hood that had noticeable grease build up that may drip onto the open spring roll contaminating the food. 
-Sauce that was open placed under an electronic bug zapper, flies/bugs can get blown into the food which could contaminate the food.
- Raw meat in the walk-in freezer was stored above the ready to eat food. Raw meat should be stored below the ready to eat foods to prevent cross-contamination of food.
violations.corrective_action:
-Ensure that all food in the fridge is covered to prevent physical or biological contaminants in the food and raw meat is stored on the bottom shelves in the freezer to minimize the risk of raw meat contaminating ready to eat food or produce.
-Ensure that the exhaust hood is regulary cleaned to avoid grease build-up.
-Food must not be stored under the electronic bug zapper.

violations.description: Equipment/utensils/food contact surfaces are not of suitable design/material [s. 16; s. 19]
violations.observation: Observed a bowl used as a scoop for cornstarch. Equipment without handles should not be used for scooping food as it is difficult to identify same had contact area which in may cause cross contamination.
violations.corrective_action: Ensure that scoops used on the facility are of suitable design with a handle to prevent cross contamination. Education provided during time of inspection and operator removed the bowl.

violations.observation:
Bowl was left in product for ongoing use in ingredient bin. Food items were stored on the ground, including in a colander. Plastic containers were being used for food storage and the operator was unsure if they were food grade. Chicken was being thawed in direct contact with the sink.
(Public Health Significance) Improper scoops and scoop storage exposes items to bare hand contact and potential contamination. Food items stored on the ground and in direct contact with a sink can become contaminated with cleaning chemicals and disease-causing microbes. Non-food grade plastic can contaminate food items with chemicals and micro-plastics.
violations.corrective_action: Store scoops so that foods are not exposed to the handles or bare hand contact. Store food scoops in a sanitary manner and clean and sanitize them regularly. All food should be stored at least 15 cm off the ground, and must also be stored in food grade containers. Food items should ideally be thawed in sanitized containers instead of directly in contact with the sink (however, the sink can be used if thoroughly cleaned and sanitized before use).

violations.observation: Operator has not provided acceptable written food handling procedures. Working on their Food Safety Plan.
violations.corrective_action: Provide a written copy of the facilities Food Safety Plan using the templates previously provided.

violations.observation: Inadequate sanitizing rinse temperature. Rinse cycle temperature is less than 71C. (Public Health significance) - High Temperature Automatic dish washers must provide a sanitizing rinse at 71C or more to sanitize dishware. Gauge temperatures must meet manufacturer's specifications.
violations.corrective_action: Immediately initiate hand sanitizing providing a 100 ppm chlorine soak for 2 minutes for all dish ware after cleaning. Have the dishwasher repaired by a qualified technician and monitor and log the rinse temperature regularly so you know when the unit needs adjustment or repair.

violations.description: Food premises not maintained in a sanitary condition [s. 17(1)]
violations.observation: Food contact surfaces were kept clean and sanitary, however other areas were noticeably dirty. Public Health significance - Contamination of food can still occur if non-food contact surfaces are not kept clean and sanitary, and can also attract and provide food for pests.
violations.corrective_action: Increase cleaning frequency of less frequently cleaned areas of facility (e.g., around the dishwasher and under the deep fryers). Add these items as part of the cleaning schedule in the Sanitation plan.

violations.description: Operator has not provided acceptable written sanitation procedures [s. 24]
violations.observation: Operator has not provided acceptable written sanitation procedures.
violations.corrective_action: Provide a written copy of a Sanitation plan using the template provided previously.

violations.observation: A person in charge who has Level 1 FOODSAFE training must be on at all times the establishment is in operation. Other staff have FOODSAFE level 1, but the operator is working on completing it themselves.
violations.corrective_action: Ensure staffing schedules provide for FoodSafe trained personnel to be present at all times.

violations.observation:
Bowls used as scoops are left in product for ongoing use in ingredient bins. Some food was stored without covers, or were on the ground.
(Public Health Significance) Improper scoops and scoop storage exposes items to bare hand contact and potential contamination. Food may become contaminated when stored without covers or when on the ground.
violations.corrective_action: Store scoops so that foods are not exposed to the handles or bare hand contact. Store food scoops in a sanitary manner and clean and sanitize them regularly. Ensure that food is properly stored and covered, and is also not stored on the ground.

violations.observation: Operator did not have Food Safety or Sanitation plans on-site during the inspection. Public Health Significance - Food Safety plan are written steps to ensure that food is kept safe from the time it is received to the time it is served to the public. Sanitation plans are written steps to ensure that the facility remains clean and sanitary to prevent contamination of food.
violations.corrective_action: Prepare Food Safety and Sanitation plans - EHO attached guidelines and templates with previous inspection report.

violations.observation: Inadequate sanitizing rinse temperature. Rinse cycle temperature is less than 71C.
