name: Purple Cafe

violations.observation: Dairy cream for coffee was being held out at room temperature for over 2 hours. Growth of foodborne illness-causing organisms may occur if potentially hazardous foods requiring refrigeration are held at room temeprature for an extended period of time.
violations.corrective_action: Cream was disposed of during inspection. A new pot for cream was prepared and stored inside of the fridge. Ensure that any dairy products held at room temperature are either completely used up or disposed of within 2 hours

violations.observation: Scoop for ice machine observed stored directly on top of ice during inspection. High-touch surfaces such as scoop handles should not be in direct contact with ready-to-eat foods such as ice due to the potential for cross-contamination leading to illness.
violations.corrective_action: Scoop was removed and stored separately from the ice machine during inspection.

violations.observation: Onions stored directly under 2-compartment sink inside of cabinet. Area is disorganized with bags,containers, cleaning supplies and is not an appropriate storage space for food due to the potential for cross-contamination.
violations.corrective_action: Move onions to a dedicated food storage area.

violations.description: Food premises not maintained in a sanitary condition [s. 17(1)]
violations.observation: Garbage from receptacle was seen to be overflowing on to the floor during inspection (dairy cartons, food packaging, etc). Waste should be kept contained and separated from any nearby food and food preparation areas in order to limit potential for contamination.
violations.corrective_action: Clean the area surrounding the garbage receptable from any waste and ensure that garbage is kept contained properly in the future.

violations.description: Equipment/utensils/food contact surfaces are not in good working order [s. 16(b)]
violations.observation: Small fridge beside dry storage closet needs de-icing/repair to ensure that the doors can fully close and the unit can maintain 4 C at all times. The store is currently working with very limited food storage space that introduces further risk of cross-contamination and cleaning difficulties.
violations.corrective_action: Fridge is to be repaired or replaced.

geocoded_address: 299, Victoria Street, Prince George, Regional District of Fraser-Fort George, British Columbia, V2L 4Y2, Canada

name: Queen of Harts

violations.observation: Inadequate sanitizing rinse solution. No sanitizer (chlorine) detected in dishwasher. (Public Health significance) - Automatic chlorine dish washers must provide a minimum concentration of 50 ppm as required to effectively sanitize dishwares.
violations.corrective_action: Operator primed and repaired the dishwasher. It was able to dispense a minimum of 50 ppm chlorine. Ensure dishwasher technician check dishwasher sanitizer level regularly.

violations.observation: Foods were left uncovered and open to contamination inside cooler and freezer. Contamination of food from contact with objects, people, pests or chemicals can increase risk of illness.
violations.corrective_action: Cover or otherwise protect all foods from airborne contaminants, drips from raw foods, and contact with objects and staff

violations.observation: Quat sanitizer was detected at 50 ppm in two wiping cloth containers. Quat sanitizer must reach at least 200 ppm to effectively destroy microbial contamination on food-contact surfaces that may increase the risk of foodborne illnesses.
violations.corrective_action: Operator immediately discarded and re-filled the two containers with 200 ppm QUAT. Continue to monitor sanitizer concentration and change solution regularly.

violations.observation: Inadequate chlorine sanitizing rinse detected in automatic dish washers. Chlorine dishwasher must provide a minimum concentration of 50 parts per million (ppm) to effectively sanitize dishware to prevent the growth of harmful microorganisms.
violations.corrective_action: Requested operator to set up manual sanitization sink with their two compartment sink and educated operator on sanitizing procedure using two compartment sink. Operator should continue to use sink to sanitize until dishwasher could be repaired.

geocoded_address: Hart Highway, The Hart, Prince George, Regional District of Fraser-Fort George, British Columbia, V2K 1W2, Canada

name: Quizno's Classic Sub

violations.description: Equipment/utensils/food contact surfaces are not in good working order [s. 16(b)]
violations.observation: Surface of the kitchen cart is not smooth and difficult to clean. Additionally, this cart is activating blocking the handwashing sink and preventing employees from easy access to the sink. All equipment surfaces should be smooth and easy to clean to prevent contamination. Handwashing sink should not be blocked to encourage handwashing.
violations.corrective_action: Operator to ensure surface of kitchen cart is smooth and easy to clean. Cart should not be blocking handwash station.

violations.observation: Temperature of the refrigerator by the sink was measured at 9.7°C. There are plans to replace the refrigerator by the end of next month. Fridge is currently used to store muffins and sauces only. Commercial sauces with egg and milk as ingredients that were labeled "Keep refrigerated" were also stored inside the fridge. Sauces with potentially hazardous ingredients such as egg and milk can support the growth of harmful microbes. Sauces should be stored at 4°C or colder to prevent microbial growth that may increase the risk of foodborne illness.
violations.corrective_action: Operator moved all sauces with the "Keep Refrigerated" label to a working cooler. Potentially hazardous food, such as sauces with milk and egg as ingredients, should not be stored inside this cooler until it has been repaired or replaced.

violations.observation: Surface temperature for deli cooler located next to sink was measured at 9°C. Various deli and sauces were stored inside cooler. Refrigeration temperature for perishable foods must be kept at a minimum of 4°C or below to prevent the growth microbes that could lead to foodborne illnesses.
violations.corrective_action: Operator moved all potentially hazardous food items to functioning refrigeration unit. Operator must put a sign on cooler to ensure no potentially hazardous food would be stored inside cooler until it had been fixed or replaced.

violations.observation: Broccoli cheese soup was measured at 31°C at the hot holding unit. The soup was stack on another metal container to preventing it from getting too hot and stick to container. All potentially hazardous foods must be stored at 60°C or above to prevent bacterial growth and risk of food borne illnesses.
violations.corrective_action: Operator removed the empty metal insert below the soup during inspection. Ensure that items held in the hot holding unit are kept at 60 C at all times.

violations.observation: Sanitizer bucket with wiping cloth was not readily available in store. Feeder was not dispensing QUAT sanitizer properly due to empty sanitizer bag. Inadequate sanitation cannot effectively reduce the microbial load on food contact surfaces and equipment, increasing the risk of foodborne illness.
violations.corrective_action: Operator replace QUAT sanitizer bag and prepared sanitizer bucket with wiping cloth. Ensure sanitizer is readily available at all time during operating hours.

violations.observation: Employee working at time of inspection does not have FOODSAFE level 1 or equivalent training. At least one employee should have training each shift to ensure food prepared in premise is safe, reducing risk of foodborne illnesses.
violations.corrective_action: Operator to schedule training for employee as soon as possible. Ensure at least one staff member should have FOODSAFE when in operation.

geocoded_address: Husky, 8087, Hart Highway, Prince George, Regional District of Fraser-Fort George, British Columbia, V2K 3B8, Canada

violations.observation: QUAT (Qauternery Ammonium Compound) sanitizer solution used for sanitizing food contact surfaces was measured below 200 ppm. (Public health significance)- For effective sanitation, Quat solutions applied to food contact surfaces must be maintained within the range of 200ppm -400 ppm. When sanitizer levels fall below this threshold, surfaces may not be properly disinfected, allowing harmful pathogens to persist. These pathogens could contaminate food items and, if consumed, may lead to foodborne illness.
violations.corrective_action: Operator was able to prepare fresh batch of QUAT sanitizer solution at 200 ppm -400 ppm at the time of inspection.

violations.observation: The hand washing station unit in the serving area did not have hot running water at the time of inspection. (Public Health Significance) Hand washing is an important practice to ensure food are protected from cross contamination from other previously handled foods or contact surfaces.
violations.corrective_action: Ensure that there is hot running water available. Operator confirmed that an order for the repair has been sent in and the technician/pumber will be coming to fix the hot water issue on this station tonight. A follow up will be conducted to ensure hot running water is available.

violations.observation: Observed cartons of liquid whole egg past the best before date stored in the walk-in cooler. Public health significance - Best before dates indicate the potential shelf life of the food products. If food products not stored under appropriate conditions, there is a potential for the growth of spoilage organisms past the best before date.
violations.corrective_action: Staff immediately moved the food products past the best before date. Operator to follow First in First out method while storing food items and discard the food products past the best before date.

violations.observation: Adequate sanitizer concentration not detected in sanitizer container close to the prep sink. Quats was measured at 50 ppm (Public Health Significance) Sanitizing solutions must be strong enough to destroy bacteria on surfaces to prevent the contamination of staff, clients or food on contact with the improperly cleaned surface.
violations.corrective_action: Staff immediately refilled sanitizing solutions to maintain an effective concentration of 200 ppm Quats.

violations.description: Items not required for food premises operation being stored on the premises [s. 18]
violations.observation: Food handler's cell phones were sitting on top of the meat slicer.
violations.corrective_action: Ensure items (personal belongings) not essential to food operation be stored in a separate, designated area that prevents contamination of food or food contact surfaces.

name: Quizno's Classic Subs on Central
full_address: 663 Central Street West, Prince George, V2M 3C6

violations.observation: Potentially hazardous cold foods are stored above 4°C. Processed vegetables were measured at 11.8 degrees Celsius in one of the prep coolers. Staff claim that they recently checked the prep coolers temperature during lunch, and were storing hot racks (measured between 40-66 degrees Celsius) within the cooler next to the vegetables. Public Health significance - All potentially hazardous foods must be stored at below 4°C or above 60°C - out of the danger zone to prevent bacterial growth and possibly food borne illness. Storing hot racks in the cooler will increase the temperature within the cooler & can lead to temperature abuse.
violations.corrective_action: Move potentially hazardous cold foods to working refrigeration units that maintain a temperature of 4°C or less, monitor and adjust the temperatures or have serviced, as required. Dispose of any potentially hazardous cold foods stored above 4°C for more than 2 hours. Racks from the oven must not be stored in the prep cooler.

violations.observation: Some of the cutting boards and knife handles are no longer smooth and easily cleanable. Food contact surfaces that are not in good working order cannot be easily cleaned, and can harbour bacteria.
violations.corrective_action: Ensure that all food contact surfaces are smooth, non-porous, and easily cleanable.

violations.description: Plans/construction/alterations not in accordance with the Regulation [s. 3; s. 4]
violations.observation: Some surfaces, such as parts of cupboard doors are not easily cleanable. Public Health significance - surfaces that are not smooth, impervious to moisture, and easily cleanable can lead to contamination of food or utensils, and foodborne illness.
violations.corrective_action: Repaint or refinish any surfaces that are not smooth, impervious to moisture, and easily cleanable.

violations.observation: Potentially hazardous cold foods are stored above 4°C. Chicken on top of prep cooler was measured at 7.6 degrees Celsius with a probe thermometer. Staff claimed that temperatures were acceptable when the stored opened. Public Health significance - All potentially hazardous foods must be stored at below 4°C or above 60°C - out of the danger zone to prevent bacterial growth and possibly food borne illness
violations.corrective_action: Move potentially hazardous cold foods to working refrigeration units that maintain a temperature of 4°C or less, monitor and adjust the temperatures or have serviced, as required.

violations.observation: Observed staff storing their keys on a cutting board in the storage area, as well as gloves on a dry storage rack. Staff lockers are readily available but are not being used properly. Paper towel dispenser was noticeably dirty as well. Storing personal items in the food preparation area, as well as improper cleaning of paper towel dispenser, can lead to contamination & foodborne illness.
violations.corrective_action: Staff need to store all personal items in staff lockers, or away from food preparation & storage areas. All surfaces that came into contact with personal items need to be cleaned & sanitized before using again. Ensure that paper towel dispenser is kept in a sanitary condition.

violations.observation: Underside of slicer carriage had food debris at time of the inspection. Public Health Significance - improper cleaning and sanitizing of surfaces allows bacterial growth, and potential foodborne illness, due to contamination of food in contact with the improperly cleaned surface. Listeria outbreaks have been linked to improperly cleaned & sanitized meat slicers..
violations.corrective_action: Ensure that all food contact surfaces and meat slicers are cleaned and sanitized thoroughly, and are kept in a sanitary manner. If the meat slicer is observed in an unsanitary manner again, Northern Health may issue a Violation Ticket.

violations.observation: Potentially hazardous cold foods are stored above 4°C. Meat products stored in top of prep cooler was measured between 4.9-7.1 °C. On-site temperature logs claim the cooler was below 4°C at 11am.  Public Health significance - All potentially hazardous foods must be stored at below 4°C or above 60°C - out of the danger zone to prevent bacterial growth and possibly food borne illness
violations.corrective_action: Move potentially hazardous cold foods to working refrigeration units that maintain a temperature of 4°C or less, monitor and adjust the temperatures or have serviced, as required. Recommend keeping insert lids on items in top portion of prep cooler to protect from contamination and keep cold. Dispose of any potentially hazardous food stored above 4 °C for more than 2 hours.

violations.observation: Light bulbs in back-end of restaurant doesn't have a cover, which could lead to glass contamination of surrounding area in the event of the light's breaking.
violations.corrective_action: Ensure that all light bulbs are either shatterproof, or have covers.

violations.observation: Underside of slicer blade had food debris at time of the inspection. Public Health Significance - improper cleaning and sanitizing of surfaces allows bacterial growth, and potential foodborne illness, due to contamination of food in contact with the improperly cleaned surface. Listeria outbreaks have been linked to improperly cleaned & sanitized meat slicers.
violations.corrective_action: Ensure that all food contact surfaces and meat slicers are cleaned and sanitized thoroughly, and are kept in a sanitary manner.

violations.description: Equipment/utensils/food contact surfaces are not in good working order [s. 16(b)]
violations.observation: Some surfaces, such as parts of cupboard doors & chipped metal racks in walk-in cooler, are not easily cleanable. Public Health significance - surfaces that are not smooth, impervious to moisture, and easily cleanable can lead to contamination of food or utensils, and foodborne illness.
violations.corrective_action: Repaint or refinish any surfaces that are not smooth, impervious to moisture, and easily cleanable.

violations.description: Conditions observed that may allow entrance/harbouring/breeding of pests [s. 26(b),(c)]
violations.observation: Weather stripping at the back door was worn out, which may lead to entrance of pests.
violations.corrective_action: Ensure that the weather stripping is replaced and does not allow entrance of pests.

violations.description: Food premises not maintained in a sanitary condition [s. 17(1)]
violations.observation: Observed some of the hard-to-reach areas under equipment and storage, as well as some of the handles for the prep coolers and cupboards were dirty during the inspection.
violations.corrective_action: Ensure that all areas of the food facility are cleaned on a regular basis, and food contact surfaces are kept clean and sanitary.

violations.description: Premises not maintained as per approved plans [s. 6(1)(b)]
violations.observation: A box of light tubes were stored at the top of a shelf in the back area. The same shelf was used to store containers and other materials that might come into contact with food.
violations.corrective_action: Light tubes and other equipment that may cause a potential cross contamination to other equipment or materials must be stored separately. Remove the box of light tubes from the top of the shelf and store it away at a designated location away from food or equipment that may come into contact with food and high traffic area.

violations.observation: Cooked beef in original vacuum seal packaging found by walk-in freezer in a bucket at 8°C. Room temperatures may allow pathogens to grow and potentially cause foodborne illnesses when consumed.
violations.corrective_action: Beef was immediately moved to the fridge during the inspection as it has been there for less than two hours.

violations.description: Equipment/utensils/food contact surfaces are not in good working order [s. 16(b)]
violations.observation: Some of the serving spatulas observed during the inspection were damaged and had missing pieces. These utensils pose a potential contamination risk and must be discarded immediately to maintain food safety standards and prevent foreign object hazards.
violations.corrective_action: Any broken or damaged dishes, including serving utensils such as spatulas, must be discarded to prevent potential contamination.

violations.description: Operator has not provided acceptable written sanitation procedures [s. 24]
violations.observation: During the inspection, no written protocols were available to guide staff in responding to contamination events, such as blood spills or food-related incidents. The absence of a Food Safety and Sanitation Plan also limits the ability of staff to reference approved procedures and undermines the facility’s preparedness in the event of a public health concern.
violations.corrective_action: Develop/update and implement a written contamination response protocol that clearly outlines all required cleaning and sanitization steps. This protocol must include notification procedures to inform the Public Health Protection Branch, Northern Health, of any incidents occurring in the kitchen or involving food items. Additionally, ensure that a current Food Safety and Sanitation Plan is always available and accessible in the kitchen. All food service staff must be trained on these documents and procedures to ensure consistent and informed responses to future incidents.

violations.observation: Observed chlorine/bleach (labelled) spray bottle that was refilled with soap instead of the bleach. violations.corrective_action: Staff correctly labelled the container to match the contents inside it.

geocoded_address: 171, George Street, Prince George, Regional District of Fraser-Fort George, British Columbia, V2L 3B1, Canada

violations.observation: Accumulation of oil and grease was observed on the wall and floor beneath the fryer area table in the kitchen. Grease buildup was also observed between the vents in the hood. Operator mentioned that the grease has been leaking from tthe hood on top of the fryers and the grill.  (Public health significance) - Grease, oil and dirt accumulation can attract pests and can create unsanitary environment, increasing the risk of cross-contamination thereby causing adverse health effects. It can also be a fire hazard due to the flammability of oil.
violations.corrective_action: Operator was advised to thoroughly clean the affected area & implement a more frequent cleaning schedule until the leaking vent hood is repaired. Operator mentioned that this will get repiared in a week's time. Regular deep cleaning must be done to maintain sanitation and prevent grease & dirt from accumulated.

violations.observation: Seats in the dining area were observed to be badly torn making them difficult to clean and sanitize. (Public Health significance): Damaged seating surfaces can harbor dirt and microorganisms creating unsanitary conditions & increasing the risk of cross-contamination to customers. Proper materials and finishing are required to ensure adequate cleaning and sanitizing.
violations.corrective_action: Operator was advised to repair or replace the torn seat covers to ensure all surfaces are smooth & intact making it easier to clean and sanitize effectively.

violations.observation: Containers of uncovered food were observed stored in the walk-in cooler in the kitchen. (Public health significance)- Food left uncovered exposes them to contamination (physical, chemical or biological) risk which could compromise the safety of food potentially leading to food-borne illness.
violations.corrective_action: Operator must cover all the food items in the food premises to prevent it from getting contaminated.

violations.observation: Uncovered food containers stored directly beneath an overhead light fixture that lacked shatterproof cover was observed in the walk-in freezer. (Public health significance)- Uncovered light fixtures may contaminate food items stored beneath them in case the light breaks, exposing the food with broken glass posing a physical contamination risk to the food thereby compromising food safety.
violations.corrective_action: Operator is aware of the issue and stated that the light coverings will be replaced soon.

violations.observation: Sanitizer solution (sink & surface) buckets with wiping cloths for wiping food contact surfaces were observed in different areas of the kitchen. The sanitizer concentration was measured to be below the acceptable levels when tested using both EHO and operator test strips. (Public health significance)- Inadequate concentration of sanitizer solutions may fail to effectively kill harmful microorganisms on food contact surfaces thereby increasing the risk of cross-contamination which could lead to foodborne illness.
violations.corrective_action: Operator was advised to ensure sanitizer solutions are at the right concentration & monitor concentrations frequently & when deemed necessary throughout the day using test strips. Staff should also monitor the sanitizer solution & replace it as deemed necessary to maintain effectiveness.

violations.observation: Mice droppings were observed in multiple locations, including the back dry storage room (in the corner near the door & between shelves) and beside the ice machine in the kitchen area. (Public health significance)- The presence of mice droppings indicates active pest activity, which poses a risk of contamination to food & food-contact surfaces. Rodents can cross-contaminate food & food contact surfaces through their feces & urine, potentially leading to foodborne illness & adverse health effects.
violations.corrective_action: Operator was advised to thoroughly clean & sanitize all affected areas. Ensure mask & gloves are worn during the cleaning process as there is a potential for aerosolization of the droppings which can be harmful. Operator was asked to assign staff to monitor for pest activity daily.

violations.description: Conditions observed that may allow entrance/harbouring/breeding of pests [s. 26(b),(c)]
violations.observation: A few openings were noted in the dry storage room & kitchen roof, which could allow for pest entry into the food premises. (Public health significance)- Openings allowing pest entry into the food premises can allow pests to enter & harbour in the food premises which can cross-contaminate food and food contact surfaces through their feces & urine (rodents), potentially leading to foodborne illness & adverse health effects.
violations.corrective_action: Operator advised to discuss with the pest control company to identify and seal all potential entry points and also find if there is mice breeding inside the food premise.

violations.description: Food premises not maintained in a sanitary condition [s. 17(1)]
violations.observation: Accumulation of oil and grease was observed on the wall and floor beneath the fryer area table in the kitchen. Grease buildup was also observed between the vents in the hood. The buildup appeared to have developed over an extended period, indicating inadequate cleaning frequency. (Public health significance)- Grease, oil and dirt accumulation can attract pests and can create unsanitary environment, increasing the risk of cross-contamination thereby causing adverse health effects. It can also be a fire hazard due to the flammability of oil.
violations.corrective_action: Operator was advised to thoroughly clean the affected area & implement a more frequent cleaning schedule. Regular deep cleaning must be done to maintain sanitation and prevent grease & dirt from accumulated. Overall sanitation of the facility needs to be improved.

violations.description: Equipment/utensils/food contact surfaces are not of suitable design/material [s. 16; s. 19]
violations.observation: Seats in the dining area were observed to be badly torn making them difficult to clean and sanitize. (Public Health significance): Damaged seating surfaces can harbor dirt and microorganisms creating unsanitary conditions & increasing the risk of cross-contamination to customers. Proper materials and finishing are required to ensure adequate cleaning and sanitizing.
violations.corrective_action: Operator was advised to repair or replace the torn seat covers to ensure all surfaces are smooth & intact making it easier to clean and sanitize effectively.

violations.description: Items not required for food premises operation being stored on the premises [s. 18]
violations.observation: An unused refrigeration unit was observed in the kitchen area. The unit has been out of use and is unused for a while according to the operator. (Public health significance)- Unused equipment in the food preparation area can hinder effective cleaning thereby accumulate dust & debris which can become a potential harborage site for pests and bacteria. This can increase the contamination of food which may result in foodborne illness.
violations.corrective_action: Operator was advised to remove the unused refrigerator from the kitchen area to facilitate cleaning & maintenance, and to prevent potentil pest harborage and contamination risks.

violations.observation: Evidence of mice droppings was noted in the facility. Observed mice droppings on the shelves and floor in the storage area where cups and take out containers are stored, in the dishwashing area, shelving under the front line area  (Public Health Significance) Rodents and other pests may cross contaminate foods and surfaces or contaminate human food with feces and urine, carry parasites and other diseases.
violations.corrective_action: Remove any pest attractants such as food and water, eliminate access to the building and routes they use inside. Trap and remove the pests. Clean and sanitize area where droppings are located and monitor situation.

violations.observation: Potentially hazardous cold foods in the open top coolers are stored at above 4°C. (Public Health significance) - All potentially hazardous foods must be stored at below 4°C or above 60°C - out of the danger zone to prevent bacterial growth and possibly food borne illness. Record temperatures every 4 hours and ensure foods are discarded if they have been out in the temperature danger zone (4°C-60°C) for longer than that.
violations.corrective_action: Ensure to only store small batches of food and close the cooler lid when not in use. When over 4 hours, move potentially hazardous cold foods to refrigeration units that maintain a temperature of 4°C or less. Monitor and adjust the temperatures of open top refrigeration units.

violations.observation: Potentially hazardous hot foods (cooked bacon strips) were stored at 10°C. Manager on site mentioned that they have been told by the corporation that shelf-life for cooked bacon strips is 12 hours at room temperature. No other paperwork was available for review. (Public Health significance) - All potentially hazardous foods must be stored at below 4°C or above 60°C - out of the danger zone to prevent bacterial growth and possibly food borne illness.
violations.corrective_action: The manager was told to discard the cooked bacon strips as it had been more than 4 hours since it was cooked. All hot potentilly hazardous foods must be stored in hot holding units that are able to maintain a temperature of 60°C or more.

violations.observation: Mice droppings were observed in the back storage area. This was also confirmed by pest activity documented in the recent pest control reports. Public Health Significance - Mice feces can carry diseases and contaminate food that can lead to various foodborne as well as other illness.
violations.corrective_action: Operator to ensure all areas in the food premises are free of mice droppings. Follow proper safety measures while cleaning up the mice droppings and discard them in a safe manner.

violations.description: Conditions observed that may allow entrance/harbouring/breeding of pests [s. 26(b),(c)]
violations.observation: Back door has a gap on the right side that can allow mice and pests to enter. Mice can fit through gaps as small as a pencil tip. Observed a huge opening in the wall behind the grill. This could be an entry point for pests into the food premises. Public Health Significance - Mice feces can carry disease and contaminate food that can lead to foodborne illness.
violations.corrective_action: The operator must ensure back door is properly sealed to prevent entry of pests. The broken wall behind the grill area needs to be sealed off completely to cover up any holes or opening into the kitchen area.

violations.description: Food premises not maintained in a sanitary condition [s. 17(1)]
violations.observation: Large build-up of food debris, grease, and grime in various areas of the restaurant. This can affect sanitation and attract pests.
violations.corrective_action: Regularly clean and sanitize all food contact surfaces, underneath and behind the equipment, and tools and equipment to prevent build up of dirt and debris. Ensure the general facility is cleaned and sanitized before the next follow-up visit.

name: Red Tomato Pies

violations.observation: Scoops were observed stored directly inside containers of flour and sugar. (Public health significance)- Scoops are subjected to bare hand contact when they are stored inside food items as there is a risk of cross-contamination from hands, gloves etc. Such contaminated food items if consumed may result in food-borne illness.
violations.corrective_action: Operator was asked to store scoops in a sanitary manner outside the containers in a designated holder. Operator to ensure scoops are stored in a manner that prevents food not being exposed to the handles or bare hand contact.

violations.observation: Accumulation of grease was observed on the exhaust hood above the pizza machine. The hood was last cleaned professionally in August 2024 and the next cleaning is scheduled for August 2025. (Public health significance)- Grease buildup on the hood poses a fire hazard due to the flammability of oils, especially in cooking areas. It also may lead to contamination of food or food contact surfaces located directly below the hood, if the grease begins to drip thereby causing health hazards.
violations.corrective_action: Operator was asked to clean the exhaust hood above the fryers at least once a month to prevent the accumulation of grease. Operator was also advised to contact the professional hood cleaning company and increase their service frequency from once a year to at least once every six months.

violations.observation: The mechanical chemical dishwasher did not have adequate sanitizing rinse solution. Sanitizer solution bucket was empty at the time of inspection. (Public health significance) - Mechanical chemical dishwashers should be adequately dispensing sanitizing solution in order to sanitize the food handling equipment to eliminate micro-organisms that may result in foodborne illness.
violations.corrective_action: Operator was asked to replace the empty sanitizing rinse solution with a new one. After that, the sanitizing solution was tested at the surface of a plate after the final rinse cycle and test strips measured sanitizing solution (chlorine-100ppm). Operator to ensure that they are consistently monitored and tested to ensure efficiency.

violations.description: Items not required for food premises operation being stored on the premises [s. 18]
violations.observation: A motorbike and a small bed were observed in the back dry storage room at the time of inspection. These items are not required for the operation of the food premises. (Public health significance)- Storing items not required for the operation of food premises can compromise sanitation by introducing dirt, contaminants, or pests into food storage areas. This increases the risk of cross-contamination and may lead to adverse health effects.
violations.corrective_action: Operator moved the items out of the food storage area at the time of inspection. Operator to ensure that the general cleanliness of the food premises is maintained consistently.

Wipiing cloths should be stored in an appropriate level of disinfectant to prevent growth of bacteria and to limit cross-contamination between food contact surfaces.

violations.description: Equipment/utensils/food contact surfaces are not of suitable design/material [s. 16; s. 19]

This is not an acceptable surface for storage of food contact items as it is not an easily cleanable, smooth surface and may harbor bacterial growth over a long period of time.
violations.corrective_action: Remove towel and store the indicated items on a cleanable surface. Staff member suggested a wire rack for storage, this would be an acceptable storage surface.

violations.observation: No sanitizer bucket or spray bottle was set up to clean food contact surfaces. Regular sanitation of food contact surfaces is required  to destroy microbial contamination on food contact surfaces to limit risk of foodborne illnesses.

Sanitizing solutions must be strong enough to destroy bacteria on surfaces to prevent the contamination of food on contact with the improperly cleaned surface.

violations.observation: Handwashing station is being used a part of dishwashing to store dirty dishes and utensils. Public health significance - Handwashing sink should only be used for washing hands and should be fully equipped with hand soap, hot and cold running water and paper towel. This is to ensure proper use of handwashing station and to prevent cross-contamination from dirty and used dishes which further helps to prevent spread of various foodborne illnesses.

Opened barbecue sauce bottle with "refrigerate after opening" condition on label was seen kept in the storage area.
violations.corrective_action: Operator immediately discarded the milk carton and an open barbecue sauce bottle at the time of inspection. Operator to follow first in first out method while storing food items and discard the food products past the best before date.

violations.observation: Wiping cloths for food contact surfaces left on the counters between use. Ensure that wiping cloths for food contact surfaces are always stored in a sanitizing solution of 100 ppm chlorine OR 200 ppm QUATs (Qauternery Ammonium Compounds) between uses.
Operator immediately transferred wiping cloths for food contact surfaces into buckets containing QUAT solution of more 200 ppm at the time of inspection.

violations.observation: One of the fluorescent bulbs by the walk-in cooler doesn't have a cover. Some of the plastic containers used in the facility don't appear to be foodgrade. Public Health signficance - shattered bulbs can contaminate a large area with glass shards, and cause serious injury in ingested. Toxic additives in non-foodgrade plastics may leach into food stored within the container.
violations.corrective_action: Install light cover, or replace with a shatterproof bulb. Operator needs to provide evidence that plastic containers are foodgrade, or replace non-foodgrade plastic containers.

violations.observation: Evidence of mice; droppings were observed near dry storage area. Operator has hired a professional pest control company to assist. Public Health Significance - Rodents and other pests may cross contaminate foods and surfaces or contaminate human food with feces and urine, carry parasites and other diseases.
violations.corrective_action: Increase cleaning frequency to ensure that any pest attractants, such as food and water, are reduced. Eliminate access to the building and routes they use inside. Trap and remove the pests. Clean and sanitize area where droppings are located and monitor situation.

violations.observation: Hole observed in the back corner of the roof by the dry storage area. Noticeable gap was also observed under one of the back doors. Some surfaces (e.g., damaged tile flooring, and raw wood walls and chemical storage racks) are not easily cleanable. Significant amount of clutter in some areas. Public Health significance - Mice can enter the facility through small gaps, as well as hide in areas that are cluttered. Surfaces that are not easily cleanable, impervious to moisture, and smooth can allow accumulation of food debris/grease, as well as lead to cross-contamination.
violations.corrective_action: Repair hole in ceiling by back door, keep back door closed & sealed. Resurface or replace flooring, walls, etc. so that all surfaces are impervious to moisture, smooth, and easily cleanable.

violations.observation: No active sanitizer detected in one of the bleach sanitizer containers in the sushi prep area. Observed a tray imitation crab bags were stored on in the walk-in cooler was noticeably dirty. Operator also claimed that staff are only cleaning, and not sanitizing, dining area. Public Health Significance - Sanitizing solutions must be strong enough to destroy bacteria on surfaces to prevent the contamination of staff, clients or food on contact with the improperly cleaned surface.
violations.corrective_action: Change sanitizing solutions as required to always maintain an effective concentration (100-200 ppm unscented bleach, 200 ppm QUATs) - follow manufacturer's specifications. Buckets should be labelled with the chemical stored within (e.g., bleach). Ensure that all food contact surfaces and utensils are cleaned and sanitized so that they are maintained in a sanitary condition.

violations.observation: Evidence of mice; droppings were noted in the facility near the dry storage area and in a couple corners on the floor. Operator monitors for pests, has traps in place, as well as hired a professional pest control company. Public Health Significance - Rodents and other pests may cross contaminate foods and surfaces or contaminate human food with feces and urine, carry parasites and other diseases.
violations.corrective_action: Remove any pest attractants such as food and water, eliminate access to the building and routes they use inside. Trap and remove the pests. Clean and sanitize area where droppings are located and monitor situation.

violations.description: Conditions observed that may allow entrance/harbouring/breeding of pests [s. 26(b),(c)]

violations.corrective_action: Pick-up frequency and cleaning schedule for floors, storage areas, etc. must be adequate to maintain the facility in a sanitary condition. Remove all items from the building that are not required for operation of the food facility.

violations.observation: Observed operator washing gloves after cutting raw meat. Another staff member wore the same pair of gloves to complete cleaning tasks as well touched clean dishware. violations.corrective_action: Disposable gloves should only be used once, never washed, and replaced when switching between tasks that may lead to contamination e.g., from cleaning to putting away clean dishware. Handwashing must be done properly and as much as needed to prevent contamination.

violations.observation: Tofu was stored in ice, and was measured at 7°C. Processed vegetables were also stored at ambient temperatures. Processed vegetables need to be stored below 4°C, or rotated every 2 hours if kept at ambient temperatures. violations.observation: Foods were left uncovered and open to contamination. Some food containers were stored on the ground, as well as some utensils stored on cardboard. violations.corrective_action: Cover or otherwise protect all foods from airborne contaminants, drips from raw foods, and contact with objects and staff. All plastic containers that come into direct contact with food needs to be food grade, or have another appropriate barrier in place (e.g., the original food packaging) in place to prevent leaching of chemicals into food.

The use of a professional pest control operator is recommended. Clean and sanitize area where droppings are located and monitor situation.

violations.observation: Noticeable build-up of grease and food debris, especially under the dishwashing area, equipment, walls, and other hard-to-reach areas. Public Health significance - insufficient cleaning can lead to, or increase the severity of, pest infestations.
violations.corrective_action: Ensure all surfaces in the facility are cleaned on a regular basis to maintain a sanitary condition throughout.

violations.observation: Tofu was stored in ice, and was measured at 11.3°C. Processed vegetables were also stored at ambient temperatures. Public Health significance - All potentially hazardous foods must be stored at below 4°C or above 60°C - out of the danger zone to prevent bacterial growth and possibly food borne illness
violations.corrective_action: Move potentially hazardous cold foods to working refrigeration units that maintain a temperature of 4°C or less, monitor and adjust the temperatures or have serviced, as required. If continued to stored on ice, ensure that the tofu remains below 4 °C or less at all times. Processed vegetables need to be stored below 4°C, or rotated every 2 hours if kept at ambient temperatures.

violations.observation: Various implements used a scoops are left in product for ongoing use in ingredient bins. Public Health significance - Improper scoops and scoop storage exposes items to bare hand contact and potential contamination.
violations.corrective_action: Store scoops so that foods are not exposed to the handles or bare hand contact. Store food scoops in a sanitary manner and clean and sanitize them regularly.

violations.observation: Raw meat is stored above ready to eat foods and produce. Public Health significance - Contact with and dripping fluids from raw foods can contaminate other items and lead to food borne illness.
violations.corrective_action: Store raw meats below and isolated from ready to eat items and produce.

violations.observation: Foods were left uncovered and open to contamination. Some onions and pans were also stored on the ground. Public Health significance - Contamination of food from contact with objects, people, pests or chemicals can cause serious illness.
violations.corrective_action: Cover or otherwise protect all foods from airborne contaminants, drips from raw foods, and contact with objects and staff. All food items and utensils (e.g., pans) need to be stored at least 15 cm off the floor.

violations.observation: Evidence of mice; droppings were noted in the facility. Public Health significance - Rodents and other pests may cross contaminate foods and surfaces or contaminate human food with feces and urine, carry parasites and other diseases.
violations.corrective_action: Remove any pest attractants such as food and water, eliminate access to the building and routes they use inside. Trap and remove the pests. The use of a professional pest control operator is recommended. Clean and sanitize area where droppings are located and monitor situation. Any food items that may have come into contact with mice or their droppings need to be disposed of.

violations.description: Conditions observed that may allow entrance/harbouring/breeding of pests [s. 26(b),(c)]
violations.observation: Back doors were left open without screens. Public Health significance - open doors can allow entrance of pests such as mice and flies.
violations.corrective_action: Ensure that doors are kept closed or screened off to prevent entrance of pests.

violations.observation: Noticeable build-up of grease and food debris, especially under the dishwashing area, equipment, walls, and other hard-to-reach areas. Public Health significance - insufficient cleaning can lead to, or increase the severity of, pest infestations.
violations.corrective_action: Ensure all surfaces in the facility are cleaned on a regular basis to maintain a sanitary condition throughout.

violations.description: Premises not maintained as per approved plans [s. 6(1)(b)]
violations.observation: Rodenticides are used within the facility; these chemicals are banned from use within food facilities due to the risk of contamination of food with poisonous substances.
violations.corrective_action: Cease use of rodenticides within the building, and safely dispose of the rodenticide currently within the building. Rodenticides may be able to be used outside of the building, so long as it is approved by the appropriate government agency. Further information was provided to the operator via email.

geocoded_address: 8th Avenue, Prince George, Regional District of Fraser-Fort George, British Columbia, V2M 0B4, Canada

name: South Fort George Family Resource Centre
full_address: 1200 La Salle Avenue, Prince George, V2L 4J8
geocoded_address: 1200, La Salle Avenue, Prince George, Regional District of Fraser-Fort George, British Columbia, V2L 1M4, Canada

name: Spice of Life Indian Cuisine

violations.observation: A bag of onions was observed stored outside the walk-in cooler. Public Health Significance: Storing food on the floor may pose a significant risk to food safety and hygiene which may lead to foodborne illnesses. It may lead to contamination from various sources, including pests, dirt, and cleaning agents.
violations.corrective_action: The operator moved the bag of onions and stored off the floor. Operator must ensure that all food items in a food premise are stored of the floor

violations.observation: Mice droppings were observed next to the monitoring trap next to the prep-cooler- operator mentioned they cleaned out during their routine cleaning. However, they still do have mice activity in the facility but are closely working with the pest control company (ORKIN). Operator was not able to provide the pest control records requested during the previous inspection. Public Health Significance: Mice activity in a food premise may result in food becoming contaminated by foreign matter such as mice hair, faeces, urine sand pathogenic microbes carried by pests.
violations.corrective_action: Operator must ensure that the food premises is free of pest activity. Ensure that cleaning and sanitation is done to hard to reach areas inside the food preparation area.

violations.observation: The lighting in the food preparation area have not been covered with shatter-proof material. Operator noted that they have put in a request for repairs. This is a repeat violation has it was noted during the previous inspection.  Public Health Significance: Lack of shatter proof cover over the lights may lead to physical contamination of food in the event the light bulbs shatter.
violations.corrective_action: Operator must ensure that the lights in the food preparation area are covered with shatter proof material.

violations.observation: Food products in this facility are not stored in a manner that prevents contamination. It was observed that raw eggs are stored over pakoras in the walk-in cooler. Public Health Significance: Raw eggs stored over pakoras may lead to cross contamination of the food which may potentially lead to foodborne illnesses.
violations.corrective_action: Ensure that the raw eggs are not store over ready to eat/cooked food in the storage cooler. Please move the raw eggs and store in a separate shelf to prevent contamination of food.

violations.observation: A cut cucumber was observed to have been left for extended period of time (more than two hours) on top of a shelf behind the customer service area. Public Health Significance: Cut cucumbers stored at room temperature for more that two hours may pose a health risk due to potential bacterial growth.
violations.corrective_action: The operator voluntarily discarded the cut cucumber. Ensure that cut cucumbers are stored in a cooler that maintains 4°C or less.

violations.observation: Food in this food premise is not being protected from contamination during storage or handling. A bucket containing tomato paste at the lower compartment of the prep-cooler was left uncovered. A piece of cooked chicken was observed on top of the tomato paste. At the walk-in cooler, a tray containing rice was partially covered. Public Health Significance: Improper handling of food in a commercial food establishment may be at risk of cross-contamination from dust, airborne particles and bacteria which may pose health risk .
violations.corrective_action: The operator removed the piece of cooked chicken from the tomato paste and properly covered the rice in the walk-in cooler. All food in a commercial restaurant must be protected from contamination during storage.

violations.description: Food not thawed in an acceptable manner [s. 14(2)]
violations.observation: Improper thawing of fish in a bucket containing water was observed. A temperature check using probe thermometer was done and noted that the internal temperature of fish was at 17.4°C. Additionally, pieces of chicken breasts were being thawed in cold water above 4°C. A temperature check using probe thermometer showed that the internal temperature was 12.1°C. The operator noted that the fish and chicken had been held for thawing for approximately 7 hours. Public Health Significance: Improper thawing of potentially hazardous food such as fish and chicken may provide an opportunity for surviving bacteria to grow to harmful numbers which may pose significant health risk.
violations.corrective_action: The operator voluntarily discarded the improperly thawed chicken and fish. All food processing including thawing of potentially hazardous food must be done in a manner that makes the food safe to eat.

violations.observation: Improper storage of utensils in the food preparation area was noted during the inspection. Spoons and ladles were observed stored in water. This is not a proper method of storing sanitized utensils  Public Health Significance: Improper storage of clean utensils may lead to contamination which may pose health risks to the public.
violations.corrective_action: Store the clean utensils in a sanitizer or air dry them. Ensure that all utensils in the food preparation area are stored in a manner that prevents contamination.

violations.observation: Mice droppings were observed next to the stove- operator mentioned they do have mice activity but are closely working with the pest control company. Public Health Significance: Mice activity in a food premise may result in food becoming contaminated by foreign matter such as mice hair, feaces, urine sand pathogenic microbes carried by pests.
violations.corrective_action: Surfaces contaminated by pests must be cleaned and sanitized. Ensure that the facility is maintained in a manner that prevents harbourage or entry of pests.

violations.observation: Weatherstripping at the rear door is in disrepair. It was observed that when the door is closed, light from outside is visible. Public Health Significance: This may allow entry of pests that may lead to food contamination in the food preparation area.
violations.corrective_action: A food operator must maintain the food establishement in a manner that prevents entry of pests. Repair or replace the weatherstripping to prevent potential entry of pests.

violations.observation: The chemical dishwasher was not dispensing chlorine at the time of inspection. The dishwasher was run three times but no chlorine was dispensed. Public Health Significance: A dishwasher not in good working order may lead to inadequate sanitation of utensils which may pose a health risk.
violations.corrective_action: A commercial food premise operator must ensure that equipment and utensils in it are maintained in a good working order and in sanitary condition and in a manner that removes contamination. Repair the dishwasher to meet the regulatory requirements.

violations.description: Chemicals, cleansers, & similar agents stored or labeled improperly [s. 27]
violations.observation: A chlorine chemical sanitizer bottle was not labelled to identify its contents. Public Health Significance: Unlabelled chemical containers may lead to chemical contamination of food and food contact surfaces.
violations.corrective_action: The operator labelled the chlorine chemical sanitizer bottle during the inspection. Chemicals, cleansers and other similar agents associated with or required for the operation or maintenance of the food areas must be labelled to identify the contents.

violations.description: Premises not maintained as per approved plans [s. 6(1)(b)]
violations.observation: The lighting in the food preparation area are not covered with shatter-proof material: Public Health Significance: Lack of shatter proof cover over the lights may lead to physical contamination of food in the event the light bulbs shatter.
violations.corrective_action: Ensure that the lights in the food preparation area are covered with shatter proof material

violations.description: Conditions observed that may allow entrance/harbouring/breeding of pests [s. 26(b),(c)]
violations.observation: Back door was propped open at time of inspection. Open doorways allow for entry of pests and may encourage further pest activity if continued.
violations.corrective_action: Ensure that back door is kept closed when it is not in use.

violations.observation: Mechanical dish washer still not in working order. Operator/maintenance is to verify using chlorine test strips that dish washer is able to dispense 50 ppm chlorine solution. Dish washer is not draining properly and is causing water to spill around the immediate area during cycle.
violations.corrective_action: Dish washer must be repaired to achieve 50-100 ppm chlorine and drain properly as to prevent water spillage around the area. All dish ware, utensils are to continue to be sanitized manually in 3-compartment sink until this is achieved.

violations.observation: Walk-in cooler temperature observed to be at approximately 7-8 C during inspection. Thermometer inside of cooler indicated approximately 7 C and multiple food items were measured to confirm. Tray with sauce indicated 7.6 C. Potentially hazardous foods may support growth of foodborne illness-causing organisms if held above 4 C. Prep cooler outside of kitchen used to store yogurt and gulab jamun measured to be 7-8 C also.
violations.corrective_action: Walk-in cooler is to be adjusted or serviced so that it is able to maintain 4 C or less during operation.

violations.description: Food premises not maintained in a sanitary condition [s. 17(1)]
violations.observation: Ceiling and light fixture above food prep area is covered in dust and presents a physical contamination hazard for foods.
violations.corrective_action: Clean the indicated area from dust. Ensure that no food is contaminated during the cleaning process.

violations.description: Equipment/utensils/food contact surfaces are not in good working order [s. 16(b)]
violations.observation: Chemical dish washer is not dispensing any sanitizer solution at time of inspection (0 ppm chlorine). This is a repeat violation. Dish ware was being sanitized using the three-compartment sink using the appropriate method. Operator stated that the dish washer is only used for glasses as an additional step after manual sanitizing.
violations.corrective_action: Ensure that the mechanical dish washer is able to dispense sanitizer. The food premise is required to have a working mechanical dish washer. The intended use for the mechanical dish washer is for the sanitizing of dish ware, and as such should able to achieve this.

violations.observation: Hand washing sink was not stocked with paper towels during inspection.
violations.corrective_action: Ensure that the hand washing sink has paper towels, and liquid soap available for staff at all times.

violations.observation: Marinated raw chicken in the walk-in cooler was seen placed above the ready to eat curries and are without lids. This could lead to contamination of the curries when the juices from the raw chicken fall on to the curries.
violations.corrective_action: Operator to sort the food placed in the walk in cooler and make sure all the raw meat is placed on the bottom shelves.

violations.observation: No active sanitizer (bleach) was detected in a sanitizer bottle in the kitchen area. Sanitizing solutions must be strong enough to destroy bacteria on surfaces to prevent the contamination of staff, clients or food on contact with the improperly cleaned surfaces.
violations.corrective_action: Operator to educate employees on checking the concentration of sanitizer solution every day before the start of work and using the test strips.

violations.observation: kitchen back door weather strip is worn out and has a gap which could allow pests to enter the facility.
violations.corrective_action: Operator to close the gap with new weather strip.

violations.observation: Potentially hazardous foods in prep cooler and walk in cooler were seen above 4°C or higher. The internal temperature of precooked chicken pieces and curry sauce in prep cooler was observed at 5.6°C. Walk in cooler internal temperature was not consistent and was varying from 6°C to 11°C. The temperature in the lower portion of the prep cooler was observed to be at or below 4°C.
violations.corrective_action: Operator was asked to service the refrigerator units so that the temperature of the food placed in them is maintained at 4°C or lower.

violations.observation: Three compartment dishwashing sink was being used and the dishes were see soaked in the sanitization sink. When tested for chlorine with test strips it did not contain any sanitizer in it (bleach). Test strips were not available during the time of inspection.
violations.corrective_action: Method of adding bleach to the sanitization sink was demonstrated and education was provided on the importance of sanitizer step. Operator to train employees on proper dishwashing practices.

violations.observation: Back door was not self closing and had a visible gap between the floor and bottom part of the door seal. The back door was left open which can allow pests to entry
violations.corrective_action: Operator to repair the gap in the backdoor. Operator also must either leave the backdoor closed, modify it so that it is self closing, or install a screen-door to prevent pest entry

violations.observation: The internal temperature in the Prep cooler in the kitchen area was seen at 5°C to 8°C using infra-red thermometer. This cooler was placed in 2 feet distance opposite to the stove and the room temperature in the kitchen was too high. As mentioned in the routine inspection only small portions of food was being kept in the refrigerator. All potentially hazardous food must be stored at a temperature of 4°C (40°F) or less to minimize growth of pathogens which may lead to foodborne illness when consumed by the public.
violations.corrective_action: Operator to move the prep cooler away from the stove and to have it serviced so that the temperature is lowered to maintain 4°C. Operator to store the foods in walk-in cooler and only store small portions of food in the prep cooler until it is fixed.

violations.observation: Chicken mixed with spices was seen left out on the counter and the surface temperature was measured at 18°C temperature. Cook reported that it was kept out side since 1 hour.
violations.corrective_action: Employee was told to move the chicken to walk in refrigerator to maintain the temperature at 4°C (40°F) or lower. Operator to educate employees on proper food handling practices.

violations.observation: In the walk in cooler raw chicken was seen placed on a rack above the ready to eat foods (yogurt - without lid).  Food stored in the refrigerator must be in a manner that prevents cross contamination.
violations.corrective_action: Operator to move the raw chicken/meat to bottom rack and reorganise the food items in a way to prevent cross contamination. Operator to educate employees on proper storage practices.

violations.observation: Three compartment dishwashing sink was being used and the dishes were see soaked in the sanitization sink. When tested for chlorine with test strips it did not contain any sanitizer in it (bleach).
violations.corrective_action: Method of adding bleach to the sanitization sink was demonstrated and education was provided on the importance of sanitizer step. Operator to train employees on proper dishwashing practices.

violations.observation: Back door was not self closing and had a visible gap between the floor and bottom part of the door seal. The back door was left open which can allow pests to enter
violations.corrective_action: Operator to repair the gap in the backdoor. Operator also must either leave the backdoor closed, modify it so that it is self closing, or install a screen-door to prevent pest entry

violations.description: Chemicals, cleansers, & similar agents stored or labeled improperly [s. 27]
violations.observation: Spray bottle was seen unlabelled. When questioned the employee of its contents she mentioned that it is bleach solution. Use of unlabelled spray bottles may lead to chemical contamination of the food.
violations.corrective_action: Operator to properly label the spray bottle.

violations.description: Premises not maintained as per approved plans [s. 6(1)(b)]
violations.observation: A section of the floor in walk in cooler was seen damaged and the underneath floor is exposed. The exposed surface makes it hard to keep the flooring clean and sanitary manner.
violations.corrective_action: Operator to fix the flooring with smooth, durable, non-absorbing, easy to clean material.

violations.observation: Hand washing sink did not have paper towels readily available during the inspection. When questioned employees told they were using paper towels from reception area until they were replaced.
violations.corrective_action: Refill the paper towel dispenser so that all hand sinks are equipped with soap, paper towels, and cold/hot running water

violations.description: In operator’s absence, no staff on duty has FOODSAFE Level 1 or equivalent [s. 10(2)]
violations.observation: Absence of food safe certified person on the premise
violations.corrective_action: At least one person with food safe certification must be always present in the restaurant when it is operational. It is recommended that all the employees are given food safe training to ensure food safety.

violations.observation: Prep cooler in the kitchen area was left open leading to the temperature of the unit higher than 4°C. The internal temperature measured using the probe thermometer was recorded at 6°C. All potentially hazardous food must be stored at a temperature of 4°C (40°F) or less to minimize growth of pathogens which may lead to foodborne illness when consumed by the public.
violations.corrective_action: Operator to leave the prep cooler closed as often as possible and have it serviced so that the temperature is lowered to maintain 4°C

violations.observation: Back door was not self closing and had a visible gap between the floor and bottom part of the door seal. The back door was left open which can allow pests to enter.
violations.corrective_action: Operator to repair the gap in the backdoor. Operator also must either leave the backdoor closed, modify it so that it is self closing, or install a screen-door to prevent pest entry.

violations.description: Food premises not maintained in a sanitary condition [s. 17(1)]
violations.observation: Bleach solution was not readily available during operation.
violations.corrective_action: Ensure the facility is sanitized regularly and that a sanitizing solution is readily available during operation.

violations.observation: Hand wash sink did not have paper towels readily availble during the inspeciton.
violations.corrective_action: Refill the paper towel dispenser so that all hand sinks are equipped with soap, paper towels, and cold/hot running water.

violations.observation: Foods on moveable rack, in walk-in cooler were left uncovered and open to contamination. (Public Health significance) - Contamination of food from contact with objects, people, pests or chemicals can cause serious illness.
violations.corrective_action: Either cover each individual rack that contains food or cover entire rack with food grade plastic cover to protect all foods from airborne contaminants, drips from raw foods, and contact with objects and staff.

violations.observation: Raw fish that was thawing was placed on moveable rack, in walk-in cooler above dough. (Public Health significance) - Contact with and dripping fluids from raw foods can contaminate other items and lead to food borne illness.
violations.corrective_action: Store raw meats below and isolated from ready to eat items and produce.

violations.observation: Back door was left completely open with no screen/netting in place.
violations.corrective_action: Keep backdoor closed or apply netting/screen door to prevent entry of pests. Pests can enter premises and contaminate food which may lead to foodborne illness. Operator says they have someone coming in, next week to apply a netting on the door.

violations.observation: Foods were left uncovered and open to contamination in the walk in cooler, and frozen pails of food did not have their lids on. (Public Health significance) - Contamination of food from contact with objects, people, pests or chemicals can cause serious illness.
violations.corrective_action: Cover or otherwise protect all foods from airborne contaminants, drips from raw foods, and contact with objects and staff

violations.observation:
The back entrance of the facility requires a new door sweep to prevent pests from entering. 
The back door should auto shut in order to prevent it from staying open and allowing pests to enter.
violations.corrective_action:
Ensure that repairs are made to prevent pests from entering the facility. 
The operator has a monthly pest control inspection from an accredited company.

violations.description: Equipment/utensils/food contact surfaces are not in good working order [s. 16(b)]
violations.observation: The three compartment sink and prepartion sink are leaking. There are pots under the sinks catching the leaking water. This can attract pests and is a workplace hazard.
violations.corrective_action: Ensure that all plumbing is repaired and water on the floor is cleaned up.

violations.description: Premises not maintained as per approved plans [s. 6(1)(b)]
violations.observation: The facility has undergone renovations and changed the access to the food storage room without approval from the health unit.
violations.corrective_action: Submit and updated facility floor plan and food safety plan explaining how the new floor plan allows for food safety.

violations.observation: Inadequate facilities provided for hand washing. Paper towel was not available at the hand washing station.  (Public Health Significance) Hand washing is an important practice to ensure food are protected from cross contamination from other previously handled foods or contact surfaces.
violations.corrective_action: Ensure the hand wash station is accessible at all times and used only as a hand wash station whenever food is being prepared. Ensure the paper towel dispenser is working. Paper towel was placed next to the hand washing sink during the inspection.

geocoded_address: Spice of Life, 454, Douglas Street, Prince George, Regional District of Fraser-Fort George, British Columbia, V2M 1K3, Canada

name: Spicy Greens Restaurant -College Heights

violations.observation: Permit is not seen posted in the front area in a conspicuous location
violations.corrective_action: Operator to post the Northern Health permit with a valid decal in a conspicuous location for public visibility..

violations.description: Permit not posted in a conspicuous location [s. 8(7)]
violations.observation: Business permit was seen posted in the front area with Northern Health decal. Actual food permit is not seen posted.
violations.corrective_action: Operator to post the actual signed health approval permit and stick the decal on it. It must be posted in a conspicuous location.

violations.observation: Rice in the rice cooker/warmer is seen at 57°C and when questioned, employee reported that the food was being reheated. The cooker function was set to warmer which is not a proper way of reheating cold potentially hazardous foods like rice. Proper reheating will ensure disease causing bacteria are eliminated.
violations.corrective_action: Operator was educated on the proper reheating methods and the cooker was turned to cooking mode to raise the temperature of the rice to 74°C for a minimum of 15 seconds. Leftovers must be reheated to an internal temperature of  74°C or above for a minimum of 15 seconds. Operator must check the temperature of the rice in the cooker if it is reaching the 74 mark. If not he must use an alternative method for proper reheating the food.

violations.observation: An egg and pieces of water melon in a cup were seen placed on the sandwich cooler at room temperature. When questioned employee mentioned they are kept outside from last night and the fruits are for personal use. All potentially hazardous foods must be stored at or below 4°C or above 60°C to minimize growth of pathogens and toxin production which may lead to foodborne illnesses when consumed by the public.
violations.corrective_action: Operator was told to discard the temperature abused foods and was educated on not to place personal items/foods in the kitchen area which could lead to cross contamination of the food contact surfaces.

violations.description: Food not thawed in an acceptable manner [s. 14(2)]
violations.observation: Raw lamb and chicken was seen placed in the room temperature in a large bowl, the temperature of lamb was measured at 10°C and the temperature of the chicken was measured at 4°C.
violations.corrective_action: When questioned the employee mentioned that raw lamb was kept outside a hour ago and was planning to make a curry within the next 15 minutes. The chicken was moved to the walk-in refrigerator which is at 2°C. Operator was educated on proper thawing methods and to educate the employees. Ensure that total thawing and cooking time must not exceed 4 hours. Proper thawing methods will be providedi in detail in the email along with this report.

violations.observation: Sanitizer concentration in the sanitization bottle in the kitchen was seen at 0 ppm. Unsanitary food contact surfaces may contaminate the other food being prepared on the same surfaces. The food contact surfaces must be cleaned and sanitized routinely and in between preparing different food items to reduce the risk of cross contamination. .
violations.corrective_action: Operator was told to refil the sanitizer bottle with sanitizer solution and must ensure testing the concentration of the solution every day before opening the kitchen with the use of test strips.

violations.observation: The ice machine had filth build-up inside the unit in the very back and on the sides. Mould, slime build-ups are good harbouring sites for pathogens such as Salmonella, Norovirus, or E.coli and can end up transferring to the ice and possibly making a consumer sick.
violations.corrective_action: Operator was told to clean and sanitize the ice machine and to ensure a proper cleaning schedule is in place. Operator must submit an updated cleaning and sanitization plan.

violations.observation: Handwashing station was not equipped with paper towels during the time of inspection. Hands may harbour disease causing organisms and when not washed properly will lead to contamination of food and utensils and when consumed by public may lead to food borne illness.
violations.corrective_action: Operator to ensure handwashing sinks are equipped with running hot and cold water, paper towels and hand soap. Operator to install paper towels close to the handwashing sink.
