violations.description: Food premises not maintained in a sanitary condition [s. 17(1)]
violations.observation: Observed accumulation of dust and food debris below counters and food storage units in the front counter. (Public Health Significance) - Accumulation of dust and food debris in food preparation areas can contaminate the food items and may cause adverse health effects, it can also attract pests that carry disease causing organisms which may contaminate the food and cause food-borne illness.
violations.corrective_action: Ensure that the food premises is adequately deep cleaned espcially the harder to reach areas on a routine basis.

violations.description: Permit not posted in a conspicuous location [s. 8(7)]
violations.observation: The Permit to Operate issued from the health authority was posted on the wall at the backroom area of premises. Its location was hidden from public view. Public health significance: Operating permits must be posted in a conspicuous location that is reasonable viewable by the public. As such, the public will be allowed to make an informed decision about dining at the facility and ensure the operator has been permitted for sanitary and safe food handling practices.
violations.corrective_action: Relocate and post the permit to a conspicuous location that is reasonable viewable by patrons and all visitors of the facility.

violations.observation: Potentially hazardous foods (milk, cream, and premade sandwiches) were stored in a refrigerator (BOH 2) at a temperature of 6 °C or 42.8 °F. Temperature was recorded via an infrared gun and confirmed with inspector's probe thermometer and the working thermometer inside the refrigerator unit. It was ensured that food items had been stored at the observed temperature for less than 2 hours. Public health significance: Cold potentially hazardous food stored or displayed above 4 °C for more than 2 hours may allow for the growth of harmful micro-organisms (pathogens). Ingestion of foods contaminated with such pathogens may lead to foodborne illnesses.
violations.corrective_action: Store all potentially hazardous foods at a temperature of no more than 4 °C or 39 °F. Operator corrected the violation during the inspection by increasing the refrigerator unit's performance to achieve a temperature of 4 °C. This was later confirmed again by an IR gun, probe thermometer, and the thermometer inside the refrigerator.

violations.description: Frozen potentially hazardous food stored/displayed above -18 °C. [s. 14(3)]
violations.observation: Frozen potentially hazardous foods were stored in a freezer (freezer #3) at a temperature of -4 °C or 24.8 °F. Temperature was recorded via an infrared gun and confirmed with inspector's probe thermometer and the working display thermometer inside the freezer unit. Public health significance: Frozen potentially hazardous food stored above -18 °C (-0.4 °F) increase the risk of the unintended thawing of frozen food. As such, this outcome can increase the risk of survival and growth of psychrotrophic bacteria and other pathogens or parasites in frozen food that can survive at lower temperatures. Ingestion of foods contaminated with such pathogens may lead to foodborne illnesses.
violations.corrective_action: Store all frozen potentially hazardous foods at a temperature much lower than 0 °C (32 °F), ideally at or closer to -18 °C (-0.4 °F).

violations.observation: QUATs sanitizer solution inside sanitation buckets were measured at concentrations of 50 - 100 ppm. Public health significance: QUATs-based sanitizer solutions effectively disinfect surfaces against microorganisms at concentrations of 200 - 400 ppm. QUATs-based disinfectant solutions with concentrations below 200 ppm may not adequately disinfect surfaces against pathogens and increase the risk of food contact surfaces to be contaminated with pathogens that can lead to foodborne illnesses.
violations.corrective_action: Replace all QUATs disinfectant solutions inside sanitation buckets with new QUATs disinfectant solutions, and ensure the concentration of all the solutions is between 200 ppm and 400 ppm. Operator must monitor the QUATs solution every two hours or as needed to ensure the concentration is maintained at an adequate level. Solution is to be replaced when visibly dirty/cloudy.

violations.observation: Quats sanitizer concentration was noted at 50 ppm using the Quats test strips. Public health significance - Sanitizer solution should be available in the food premises to ensure adequate dishwashing and sanitizing. Sanitizing solutions must be strong enough (at least 200 ppm for Quats) to destroy bacteria on surfaces to prevent the contamination of food on contact with the improperly cleaned surface.
violations.corrective_action: Operator immediately discarded the solution in the sanitizer bucket and prepared a fresh solution which was measured to be at 200 ppm.

violations.description: Operator does not have FOODSAFE Level 1 or Equivalent [s. 10(1)]
violations.observation: Training that operator obtained is not equivalent to FOODSAFE Level 1. Proper training helps ensure operator has the knowledge to safely prepare food at the premises. This can reduce the likelihood of foodborne illness.
violations.corrective_action: Operator to obtain training equivalent to FOODSAFE Level 1. Ensure there is at least one trained employee in store during operating hours.

violations.observation: Separated hand sink and three compartment sinks at back ran out of hot running water at the time of inspection
violations.corrective_action: Ensure hot and cold running at sinks all the time.

name: Starbucks at Ramada

violations.observation: High temperature dishwasher was unable to meet the temperature mark of 71°C. Temperature was measured for atleast 4 times and the machine was run for more than 10 cycles. Improper sanitization of the dishes may lead to increase in growth of pathogens and toxin production which may lead to food borne illnesses.
violations.corrective_action: Operator to ensure manual dishwashing and sanitization of the dishes is done until the dishwasher is repaired and is able to reach 71°C temperature. If the dishwasher is dispensing Iodine, operator to ensure it is being dispensed at a concentration between 12.5 ppm 25 ppm. Test strips must be in place to routinely evaluate the sanitizer concentration .

violations.observation: No active sanitizer(QUAT) can be detected in wipe bucket. Sanitizer dispenser required adjustment before it dispensed at the correct concentration. Quat sanitizer must reach a minimum of 200 ppm to destroy foodborne pathogens and limit contamination during food preparation.
violations.corrective_action: Operator replaced the bucket with fresh QUAT sanitizer that reaches 200 ppm. Please ensure sanitizer at the correct concetration can be dispensed without extensive adjustment.

violations.observation: Two-compartment dishwashing sink was not labelled properly. Sanitizer sink was labeled as "Wash" and "Rinsed" while the wash and rinse sink was labeled as "Sanitizer." Correct labeling ensures that employees know the chemical in the sink to ensure the correct dishwashing process would be followed. Use of wrong chemicals can lead to inadequate sanitation.
violations.corrective_action: Operator to relabeled sink.

violations.observation: No active sanitizer detected in sanitizer containers. (Public Health Significance) Sanitizing solutions must be strong enough to destroy bacteria on surfaces to prevent the contamination of staff, clients or food on contact with the improperly cleaned surface.
violations.corrective_action: Change sanitizing solutions as required to always maintain an effective concentration (200 ppm unscented bleach, 200 ppm QUAT)- follow manufacturer's specifications)

violations.observation: Evidence of flies were noted in the facility. (Public Health Significance) Pests may cross contaminate foods and surfaces or contaminate human food with feces, carry parasites and other diseases.
violations.corrective_action: Remove any pest attractants such as food and water, eliminate access to the building and fly traps may be used (do not place above food preparation or storage areas). Clean and sanitize areas where pests are located and monitor situation.

violations.description: Chemicals, cleansers, & similar agents stored or labeled improperly [s. 27]
violations.observation: Chemical dispensers above the two compartment sink were improperly labelled, and were both dispensing sanitizers. Public Health significance - Use of the wrong chemicals can lead to inadequate sanitation or production of toxic gases.
violations.corrective_action: Ensure all chemical dispensers are properly labelled and connected to the correct chemical container.

violations.observation: One of the hand washing stations did not have paper towel readily available. (Public Health Significance) Hand washing is an important practice to ensure food are protected from cross contamination from other previously handled foods or contact surfaces.
violations.corrective_action: Ensure the hand wash station is accessible at all times and used only as a hand wash station whenever food is being prepared. Soap and paper towel in dispensers and hot and cold running water must be provided to facilitate proper hand washing.

violations.corrective_action: All potentially hazardous foods must be stored at or below 4°C or above 60°C to minimize growth of pathogens and toxin production which may lead to foodborne illnesses when consumed by the public. Operator was told to not use the refrigerator unit and move the potentially hazardous food (meat slices, patty, sauces and cut vegetables) into a working walk-in cooler unit that maintains a temperature of 4°C or less. violations.description: Failure to hold a valid permit while operating a food service establishment [s. 8(1)]
violations.observation: A valid Permit to Operate was not found at the food premises. Public health significance: holding a valid Permit to Operate ensures that the food premises has succesfully passed its initial inspection by an environmental health officer and continues to be regulated under the BC Food Premises Regulation for safe and sanitary operations. Permits must be posted in a conspicuous location that is reasonable viewable by the public. As such, the public will be allowed to make an informed decision about dining at the facility and ensure the operator has been permitted for sanitary and safe food handling practices.
violations.corrective_action: Operator is to obtain a new valid Permit to Operate from the health authority and place the permit in a conscpicious location within the food premises.

violations.observation: Meatballs used for pizza subs and soups (i.e., chicken noodle and cream of broccoli) were stored in hot-holding units. The surface temperatures of all three hot potentially hazardous foods was measured at 44.4 °C (111.9 °F) using an infrared gun thermometer. The internal temperatures were measured at 50.2 °C (122.4 °F) using a probe thermometer which was disinfected before and after each use. The meatballs and soups had been stored for less than 2 hours. Public health significance: Most harmful microorganisms (pathogens) can grow and reproduce between temperatures of 4 °C (40 °F) and 60 °C (140 °F). This temperature range is considered as the "danger zone" and potentially hazardous food stored in the danger zone may result in the biological and/or chemical contamination of the food. Ingestion of contaminated food may lead to foodborne illnesses.
violations.corrective_action: Operator (supervisor) discarded and replaced the small remaining volume of soap. The meatballs were reheated to an internal temperature of 74 °C (165.2 °F) for a minimum of two minutes and hot-held at no less than 60 °C (140 °F). Adequate surface and internal temperatures were verified via infrared gun and probe thermometers, respectively. Operator was instructed to continue to monitor the temperatures of the hot-held food and to discard and replace after two hours if food was stored at less than 60 °C (140 °F) in the hot-holding units.

violations.observation: Quaternary Ammonium Compounds (QUATs) sanitizer solution inside three-compartment sink and sanitizer bottles were measured at a concentration of 100 ppm and 50 ppm, respectively, via test strip. Public health significance: QUATs-based solutions effectively sanitize surfaces against microorganisms at concentrations of 200 - 400 ppm. QUATs-based solutions with concentrations below 200 ppm may not adequately sanitize surfaces against pathogens and increase the risk of food contact surfaces to be contaminated with pathogens that can lead to foodborne illnesses.
violations.corrective_action: Operator was requested to dispensed QUATs solution directly from the container and mixed with potable water from the sink fixture to acheive a concentration between 200 and 400 ppm. The concentration of the new solution was tested by EHO and operator and measured to be 400 ppm. Operator contacted the sanitizer system provider for maintenance on the dispenser. Operator is to continue to directly dispense QUATs sanitizer solution from container and dilute with potable water inside sanitizing sink to achieve a concentration between 200 to 400 ppm. Operator is to test concentrations of the QUATs sanitizer and ensure it is adequate before using. This procedure is to be followed until maintenance or repairs can be done to directly use sanitizer dispenser. The QUATs solution inside sink and spray bottles must be monitored every two hours or when visibly dirty/cloudy to ensure the concentrations are maintained at an adequate level.

violations.description: Operator does not have FOODSAFE Level 1 or Equivalent [s. 10(1)]
violations.observation: No supervisor or staff on duty could show proof of a valid FOODSAFE Level 1 certification or equivalent at the time of inspection. Public health significance: Adequate education and training on safe and sanitary food preparation and handling is an effective way to prevent the contamination of food and preventing the spread of foodborne illnesses and communicable diseases.
violations.corrective_action: At least one supervisor or staff on duty must hold a valid FOODSAFE Level 1 certification or equivalent at all times during the facility's operation. Evidence of a valid FOODSAFE Level 1 certification must be made available to the environmental health officer. It is recommended that as many supervisors and staff to be certified in the event that the usual certified supervisor or manager is not on duty during that shift. Additionally, it is recommended that a copy of the valid FOODSAFE Level 1 certificate or equivalent to be stored and accessible within the food premises.

name: Subway on Massey

violations.observation: Potentially hazardous cold foods in the open top coolers are stored at above 4°C. (Public Health significance) - All potentially hazardous foods must be stored at below 4°C or above 60°C - out of the danger zone to prevent bacterial growth and possibly food borne illness. Record temperatures every 4 hours and ensure foods are discarded if they have been out in the temperature danger zone (4°C-60°C) for longer than that.
violations.corrective_action: Ensure to only store small batches of food and close the cooler lid when not in use. When over 2 hours, move potentially hazardous cold foods to refrigeration units that maintain a temperature of 4°C or less. Monitor and adjust the temperatures of open top refrigeration units. Ensure the temperatures for both the top and bottom of the unit are recoded when recording temperatures for the logs.

violations.observation: Cream of broccoli soup was hot-held at temperature below 60°C. The temperature recorded using IR thermometer was at 54°C. Potentially hazardous food items should be hot-held at a temperature over 60°C to prevent or limit microbial growth further preventing the spread of foodborne illnesses.
violations.corrective_action: Staff changed the temperature settings for the hot-holding unit for it to be able to maintain temperature over 60°C. The temperature measured again at the end of the inspection was recorded at 62°C.

violations.corrective_action: Operator to ensure the gaps are sealed off completely to eliminate pest access points.

violations.observation: Quat sanitizer coming from the dispensing unit was measured at 100 ppm during inspection. However, this concentration is inadequate for effective sanitization. As a result, dishware and food contact surfaces may still harbour pathogenic micro-organisms, which could potentially cause foodborne illnesses.
violations.corrective_action: Until the dispensing unit is repaired or replaced, the operator must manually add sanitizer and ensure that the QUAT sanitizer solution is maintained at least 200 ppm all times during operation. The operator should verify the sanitizer concentration using a test strip.

violations.observation: A deceased mouse was found on one of the mouse traps in the back room, accompanied by its droppings. Public health significance: rodents and other pests can contaminate food, food contact surfaces, and equipment with feces and urine. Additionally, they may carry parasites and diseases. Consuming such contaminated food can lead to foodborne illnesses.
violations.corrective_action: The deceased mouse and its droppings must be promptly removed from the premises. The operator should ensure that employees are provided with appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE) since mouse urine and feces may carry hantavirus, which can cause illness. Additionally, steps should be taken to eliminate pest attractants such as food and water, block access points to the building, and trap and remove the pests. Continue following the recommendation provided by the pest control company.

violations.observation: QUAT sanitizer measured at 100 ppm during inspection. This is not an adequate concentration of sanitizer to achieve the required level of disinfection of dish ware and food contact surfaces (5-log reduction of bacteria).
violations.corrective_action: Ensure that QUAT sanitizer solution is maintained at 200 ppm at all times during operation.

name: Thanh Vu Restaurant

violations.observation: Packaged raw meat was observed on top shelves above raw seafood and ready-to-eat food items in the freezer & refrigerator. (Public Health Significance)- Raw meat and poultry must be stored on the bottom shelf to prevent juices from contaminating lower-risk foods such as seafood, vegetables, or ready-to-eat items. These foods may be consumed raw or cooked at lower temperatures, increasing the risk of food-borne illnesses.
violations.corrective_action: Operator was asked to rearrange the food items in the freezer and refrigerator. Meat and poultry were placed on the bottom shelf, seafood was stored above them & ready-to-eat food items were placed on the top shelf to prevent cross-contamination.

violations.observation: Containers of food were stored on the floor in the freezer, refrigerator and back storage areas. (Public Health Significance) - Food items must be stored at least 15 cm (6 in.) off the floor to prevent contamination from dust, dirt & pests. Storing food items on the floor increases the risk of cross-contamination which could lead to potential food-borne illnesses.
violations.corrective_action: Operator moved the containers on the floor in the refrigerator to a rolling cart at the time of inspection. Operator ensured that the other containers will be placed on the shelves off the floor.

violations.observation: Wiping cloths left on the counters and not in the sanitizing solution (chlorine-200ppm) between use. (Public Health significance) - Cloths once used can harbour and grow bacteria if left on the counters after use at room temperature.
violations.corrective_action: Store wiping cloths in a sanitizing solution of 200 ppm chlorine. The operator was asked to place the cloths in a sanitizing solution of adequate concentration

violations.observation: Food items in the walk-in freezer in the back storage area were stored on the ground (Public Health significance) - Storage areas should have adequate shelving such that all materials, including food and food items, are maintained at a minimum of 15 cm (6 in.) off the floor on racks, shelves or pallets. Contamination of food from contact with objects, people, pests or chemicals can cause serious illness.
violations.corrective_action: Ensure all food items are placed on racks and shelves which are at least 15 cm (6 in.) off the ground to prevent contamination of food as well as to allow for cleaning.

violations.observation: Raw meat in one of the freezers was seen stored above ready to eat foods and produce. (Public Health significance) - Contact with and dripping fluids from raw foods can contaminate other items and lead to food borne illness.
violations.corrective_action: Operator moved the raw meat to a diifferent shelving at the time of inspection. Store raw meats below and isolated from ready to eat items and produce.

violations.observation: Raw meat was stored near to ready-to-eat and frozen vegetables in the walk-in cooler and freezer. Additionally, personal items were stored on shelves above rice, and lettuce was placed in metal pans on a metal table located beneath a missing ceiling tile and light cover. Chemicals were also stored behind the table, separated only by a garbage bag. *Cross-contamination between raw meat and ready-to-eat food can result in the spread of harmful bacteria. Storing personal belongings near food can introduce contaminants, like foreign objects. Furthermore, missing ceiling fixtures may lead to physical contamination (e.g., falling debris or insects), while improper storage of chemicals increases the risk of chemical contamination.
violations.corrective_action: Store raw meat separately from other foods, on the lowest shelves, in designated areas to prevent drips and contamination. Designate a separate area for personal items away from food storage and preparation zones. Install a ceiling tile and a proper light cover or do not use the area for food preparation. Relocate chemicals to a secure, designated storage area far from food preparation surfaces, if using the area for food preparation.

violations.description: Conditions observed that may allow entrance/harbouring/breeding of pests [s. 26(b),(c)]
violations.observation: A gap was observed at the back door, allowing potential pest entry. The weather stripping on the back door requires repair or replacement. *Gaps in doors offer easy access for pests, which can contaminate food and food-contact surfaces.
violations.corrective_action: Replace or repair weather stripping to ensure a tight seal on all exterior doors by August 30, 2025

violations.description: Food premises not maintained in a sanitary condition [s. 17(1)]
violations.observation: The ice machine and can opener appeared dirty at the time of inspection and water was observed below the metal table adjacent to the ice machine. *Dirty equipment can harbour and spread harmful bacteria to food or beverages and standing water fosters mold growth contributing to unsanitary conditions.
violations.corrective_action: Immediately dry and clean the area and ensure to clean and sanitize all equipment regularly according to a already established sanitation plan. Also, fix the issue to prevent any reoccurrence.

violations.description: Premises not maintained as per approved plans [s. 6(1)(b)]
violations.observation: A gap was observed at the left corner of back door. The weather stripping on the back door requires repair or replacement. *Gaps in doors offer easy access for pests, which can contaminate food and food-contact surfaces.
violations.corrective_action: Replace or repair weather stripping to ensure a tight seal on all exterior doors.

violations.observation: The handwashing station was inaccessible, blocked by a chopping board at the time of inspection. *Obstructed handwashing stations prevent food handlers from maintaining proper hygiene, increasing the risk of foodborne illness.
violations.corrective_action: Ensure handwashing stations are always accessible and free of obstructions. This violation was corrected onsite.

violations.corrective_action: N/A

violations.observation: Observed three milk cartons past the best before date in the bar walkin cooler. Best before dates indicate the potential shelf life of the food products. If food products not stored under appropriate conditions, there is a potential for the growth of spoilage organisms past the best before date
violations.corrective_action: Operator immediately discarded the food product past the best before date. Operator to follow first in first out method while storing food items and discard the food products past the best before date

violations.observation: Ice machine is missing its lid/door. Ice inside the machine is left open to contamination. Although the machine is inside a walk in cooler, it is still subject to contamination with the dust.
violations.corrective_action: Operato to fix the lid of the ice machine.

violations.observation: Throughout the kitchen employees and operator was observed to have personal items such as coffee mugs, water containers next to the food contact surfaces such as cutting boards and knives. These items pose a risk of contaminating the food prepared in this area.
violations.corrective_action: Operator is to educate employees to store all personal items in designated areas separate from the kitchen. This is the final warning, if observed again further enforcement actions is warranted.

violations.observation: Raw meats were seen stored above the ready to eat foods and vegetables in the walk in cooler and freezer. Food was observed stored on the floor in the walk-in freezer. The juices from raw eggs can drip and contaminate the food packaging and food stored underneath it.
violations.corrective_action: The operator to reorganize entire walk in cooler and freezer to ensure food are properly covered and stored in a manner that prevents cross contamination. Ensure that foods are stored at least 6" off the floor and protected from contamination

violations.observation: Two sanitizer bottles with Quats sanitizer concentration was noted at 50 ppm using the Quats test strips. Public health significance - Sanitizing solutions must be strong enough (atleast 200 ppm for Quats) to destroy bacteria on surfaces to prevent the contamination of food on contact with the improperly cleaned surface.
violations.corrective_action: Operator immediately discarded the solution and refilled it with the fresh batch of sanitizer measured to be at 200 ppm. Operator to ensure sanitizer concentration in the bottles is tested regularly with the test strips.

violations.observation: Evidence of mice; droppings were noted in the dry storage area of the facility. (Public Health Significance) Rodents and other pests may cross contaminate foods and surfaces or contaminate human food with feces and urine, carry parasites and other diseases.
violations.corrective_action: Operator to contact the pest control company for help with the mice issue and trap and remove the mice from the facility. Clean and sanitize area where droppings are located and monitor situation.

violations.observation: Back door has a gap on the bottom side that can allow mice and pests to enter. Mice can fit through gaps as small as a pencil tip. Public Health Significance - Mice feces can carry disease and contaminate food that can lead to foodborne illness.
violations.corrective_action: The operator must ensure back door is properly sealed to prevent entry of pests.

violations.description: Chemicals, cleansers, & similar agents stored or labeled improperly [s. 27]
violations.observation: Spray bottles containing different chemicals were missing appropriate labels. (Health significance) - Inaccurately labelled chemical agents can cause accidental misuse, which may result in potential contamination and inadequate sanitation of food contact surfaces.
violations.corrective_action: Ensure all chemicals used in the premises are appropriately labelled to identify the contents.

violations.observation: Wiping cloths used for wiping food contact surfaces were not stored in sanitizing solutions in the kitchen area, there were no sanitizer buckets observed to be used for storing the wiping cloths. Moist wiping cloths can become breeding grounds for disease causing mircoorganisms that could be transferred to the food contact surfaces if they are not kept in an adequate sanitizing solution.
violations.corrective_action: Operator to ensure all the wiping cloths used for the food contact surfaces are either kept stored in the sanitizer solution or replaced with new washed ones atleast every 2 hours.

violations.description: Conditions observed that may allow entrance/harbouring/breeding of pests [s. 26(b),(c)]
violations.observation: Back door was seen kept open during the time of inspeciton and has a gap that can allow mice and pests to enter. Mice can fit through gaps as small as a pencil tip.
violations.corrective_action: To prevent pests from entering the facility, the operator should keep the back door closed when it is not in use. However, if the door needs to be kept open for ventilation purposes, the operator must install an insect net with a mesh to prevent pests from entering the facility.

violations.description: Food not thawed in an acceptable manner [s. 14(2)]
violations.observation: Frozen Meats such as chicken, pork and ribs were seen kept at room temperature in kitchen prep area. Operator stated that meats will be used in the next two hours and therefore they were thawing outside in the room temperature at ~20°C. Improper thawing may create an environment for bacteria to thrive and potentially produce harmful toxins.
violations.corrective_action: The operator moved all the frozen meats that were still below 4°C into the walk-in cooler. The operator to instruct employees to use either the running water technique or a functional refrigerator to thaw frozen foods and to ensure they use the appropriate thawing techniques.

violations.observation: Wiping cloths used for wiping food contact surfaces were not stored in sanitizing solutions in the kitchen area. There were no sanitizer buckets observed to be used for storing wiping cloths. Wiping cloths, especially when moist, can become breeding grounds for disease-causing microorganisms that could be transferred to food contact surfaces if they are not kept in an adequate sanitizing solution.
violations.corrective_action: Ensure wiping cloths are stored in an adequate sanitizing solution when not in use. The sanitizing solution should be changed as often as necessary (preferably every 2 hours) to maintain the recommended concentration residual for the sanitizer.

violations.observation: Hand-sink next to the two compartment sink and dry storage room sprays water at a high pressure, splashing onto the surrounding food prep area. This can cause cross-contamination of food surfaces and food prepared in the area.
violations.corrective_action: Install splash guards by the sink to contain water being sprayed in the area when hand-washing.

violations.observation: Container of mashed potatoes stored on top of tray raw ground meat and under raw chicken in the walk in cooler. Raw meats and other potentially hazardous foods must be stored below non-potentially hazardous foods and ready-to-eat foods to avoid cross contamination.
violations.corrective_action: The mashed potatoes were voluntarily discarded. Operator to review safe food storage and how to separate storage of raw potentially hazardous foods with ready to eat foods with staff.

violations.observation: Bag of raw meat stored under wire shelving on the floor in the walk-in-freezer.
violations.corrective_action: Foods must be 6 inches above the ground for sanitary storage and reduced risk of contamination of pests.

violations.observation: Cous cous stored under raw chicken and next to schnitzel in the lower compartment of the pasta prep cooler. Meats and other potentially hazardous foods must be stored below or in separate shelves away from non-potentially hazardous foods and ready to eat items to prevent cross contamination..
violations.corrective_action: Staff were informed and told to reorganize storage of raw meats in the pasta prep cooler in a manner so that non-potentially hazardous foods are protected against cross contamination of raw meats.

Unwashed hands of food handlers can cause contamination and cross-contamination of food items, such food items if consumed can cause food-borne illness.
violations.corrective_action: Operator to ensure that the hand washing sink is stocked with single-use paper towels, liquid soap in a dispenser and hot and cold running water at all times. Operator was able to completely stock the hand washing sink at the time of inspection.

violations.observation: QUATs sanitizing solution in three compartment sink and sanitation buckets measured at 50 ppm. QUATs sanitizers must be between 200-400 ppm to effectively disinfect surfaces.

violations.observation: Potentially hazardous food items (sliced cantaloupe, cases of eggs) were observed to be stored at a temperature above 4°C (in the temperature danger zone 4°C - 60°C) in two of the refrigeration units in the back storage area. (Public Health Significance) - Potentially hazardous food items (sliced cantaloupe, cases of eggs) when stored in the temperature danger zone (4°C - 60°C) can cause growth of disease causing pathogens, such food items when consumed can cause food-borne illness.
violations.corrective_action:
Ensure that all potentially hazardous food items are stored a temperature of 4°C or colder.
  Operator tranferred the sliced cantaloupe and cases of eggs in a working refrigerator that maintained temperature of  4°C or colder at the time of inspection.

violations.observation: Food handling equipment (can opener) had build-up of food residuals and is not adequately washed and sanitized. (Public Health Significance) -  Food residuals left on inadequately cleaned can opener are exposed to room temperature which may lead to growth of disease causing pathogens and toxins, such food handling equipment (can opener) may cross-contaminate other food products when reused.
violations.corrective_action: Ensure that the food handling equipment (can opener) is frequently washed and sanitized.

violations.observation: Ice machine was observed to have build-up of biofilm slime layer. (Public Health Significance) - Build-up of biofilm layer in the ice machine indicates that it is inadequately cleaned, the biofilm slime layer can harbour disease carrying pathogens which can contaminate the ice and potentially cause food-borne illness if consumed.
violations.corrective_action: Operator to ensure that the ice machine is cleaned and sanitized frequently.

violations.description: Conditions observed that may allow entrance/harbouring/breeding of pests [s. 26(b),(c)]
violations.observation: Floor gap observed below the back-door in the back storage room. (Public Health Significance) - Floor gap below the back door can serve as an entry point for pests into the facility, pests can contaminate food and cause food-borne illness.
violations.corrective_action: Operator to ensure that a weather-strip is installed on the back-door of the back storage area in order to eliminate the floor gap.

violations.description: Food premises not maintained in a sanitary condition [s. 17(1)]
violations.observation: Accumulation of grease and grime was observed on the sides of the stove, accumulation of food debris below shelving units and harder to reach areas. (Public Health Significance) - Accumulation of grease, grime and food residuals in food handling and food storage areas can cause physical contamination of food and illnesses.
violations.corrective_action: Ensure that the food premises is thoroughly deep-cleaned especially below shelving units and harder to reach areas.

violations.description: Equipment/utensils/food contact surfaces are not in good working order [s. 16(b)]
violations.observation: Two refrigeration units in the back storage area and two mini fridges in the bar area were unable to maintain the refrigeration temperature of 4°C or colder. (Public Health Significance) - All refrigeration units should be adequately working to maintain the refrigeration temperature of 4°C or colder in order to prevent the stored food from entering the temperature danger zone (4°C - 60°C).
violations.corrective_action: Ensure that the two refrigeration units in the back storage area and the two mini fridges in the bar area are repaired/fixed such that they maintain the refrigeration storage temperature of 4°C or colder.

geocoded_address: Highway 97 Frontage South, Prince George, Regional District of Fraser-Fort George, British Columbia, V2N 6C9, Canada

name: Trench Brewing and Distilling

violations.observation: The kitchen canopy directly above the grill was observed to have grease build-up. It was further observed that some of the grease was dripping on to the floor beside the grill. Public Health Significance: Grease build-up may increase the risk of fire hazard and pest attraction which may further lead to food contamination.
violations.corrective_action: Ensure that the kitchen canopy is cleaned and maintained in good sanitary condition.

violations.description: Premises not maintained as per approved plans [s. 6(1)(b)]
violations.observation: The main floor kitchen lights do not have a shatter proof cover. Public Health Significance: Missing shatter proof covers in food preparation area may increase the risk of physical contamination of food by shattered bulbs.
violations.corrective_action: To minimize the risk of physical hazards in a food preparation area, please ensure all light fixtures have adequate light covers or shatter proof bulbs.

violations.observation: Quat sanitizer dispensed at approximately 25-50 ppm. This is not an adequate concentration of sanitizer to achieve the required level of disinfection of dish ware and food contact surfaces.
violations.corrective_action: Ensure that sanitizer is dispensed at 200 ppm. Bleach prepared to 100-200 ppm is to be used as a disinfectant until quat dispenser is serviced.

violations.observation: Hand sink in kitchen not stocked with paper towels at time of inspection.
violations.corrective_action: Ensure that paper towels are available for staff at all times during operation.

violations.observation: Cooked pasta stored directly on top of two-compartment sink in top kitchen area. This presents a potential for contamination between the food and the food handler or items washed in the sink.
violations.corrective_action: Pasta was moved to a separate area at time of inspection.

violations.observation: Quat sanitizer solution was measured at 0 ppm for spray bottles and directly from quat dispenser. Quat solution was observed to be drawn effectively, but dispensed at a high temperature (approximately 60 to 65 C). Quat sanitizer is not effective at high temperatures due to potential chemical degradation. MSDS for quat sanitizer states that storage tempearture should not exceed 50 degrees Celsius.
violations.corrective_action: Service or adjust the quat dispenser so that solution is dispensed at proper temperature. Purchase test strips to verify that the sanitizer solution is maintained at 200 ppm. 50-100 ppm bleach is to be used as the primary surface sanitizer until the operator is able to verify that quats are being dispensed as needed.

violations.observation: Two compartment sink used for hand washing in the top floor kitchen was not stocked with paper towels at time of inspection.
violations.corrective_action: Paper towel dispenser was restocked with paper towels during inspection. Do not use re-usable wiping cloths in order to dry hands in the future.

violations.observation: Potentially hazardous cold foods are stored at slightly above 4°C in the open top refrigeration unit. (Public Health significance) - All potentially hazardous foods must be stored at below 4°C or above 60°C - out of the danger zone to prevent bacterial growth and possibly food borne illness
violations.corrective_action: Operator to ensure that the open top refrigeration unit remains closed when not in use and to move potentially hazardous cold foods within the refrigeration unit to ensure proper air flow in order to maintain a temperature of 4°C or less.

violations.observation: Inadequate concentration of Quats solution in spray bottles. Test strips not available at the time of inspection. (Public Health significance) - The Quats sanitizing solution must provide a minimum concentration of 200 parts per million (ppm) as required to effectively sanitize food contact surfaces.
violations.corrective_action: Operator instructed to prepare fresh sanitizing solution each day and to acquire test strips to ensure 200 ppm Quats solution concentration at all times.

violations.observation: Potentially hazardous cold foods are stored at above 4°C. (Public Health significance) - All potentially hazardous foods must be stored at below 4°C or above 60°C - out of the danger zone to prevent bacterial growth and possibly food borne illness
violations.corrective_action: Move potentially hazardous cold foods to working refrigeration units that maintain a temperature of 4°C or less, monitor and adjust the temperatures or have serviced, as required.

violations.observation: Inadequate sanitizing rinse solution. No sanitizer detected. (Public Health significance) - Automatic dish washers must provide a minimum concentration of 50 parts per million (ppm) as required to effectively sanitize dishware, 100 ppm recommended; Hand washing requires 200 ppm unscented bleach solution.
violations.corrective_action: Immediately initiate hand sanitizing providing a 200 ppm soak for 2 minutes for all dish ware. Have the dishwasher repaired by a qualified technician and monitor and log sanitizer concentration regularly so you know when the unit needs adjustment or repair.

violations.description: Food premises not maintained in a sanitary condition [s. 17(1)]
violations.observation: There was excessive dust accumulated on the walls and fans of the walk-in cooler
violations.corrective_action: The dust propelled onto the walls can be deposited onto the foods stored in the cooler which may potentially lead to cross contamination of food products. The operator was told to clean the walls and fans of the walk-in cooler and follow the sanitation plan for regular cleaning.

violations.description: Premises not maintained as per approved plans [s. 6(1)(b)]
violations.observation: A broom and garbage picking devices were stored right beside a rack full of food supplies in front of the walk-in cooler
violations.corrective_action: Placing janitorial equipment right beside the food products may lead to cross contamination. The operator must move the janitorial equipment to another area away from the food products.

name: Uda Dune Baiyoh - House of Ancestors

violations.observation: Observed carton of cream past the best before date in the refrigeration unit in the prep area. Public health significance - Best before dates indicate the potential shelf life of the food products. If food products not stored under appropriate conditions, there is a potential for the growth of spoilage organisms past the best before date.
violations.corrective_action: Staff immediately discarded the food product past the best before date. Operator to follow First in First out method while storing food items and discard the food products past the best before date.

violations.observation: Raw meat is stored with ready to eat foods in the walk-in freezer. (Public Health significance) - Contact with and dripping fluids from raw foods can contaminate other items and lead to food borne illness.
violations.corrective_action: Store raw meats below and isolated from ready to eat items and produce.

violations.observation: Food items in the walk-in freezer and dry storage area were stored on the floor. (Public Health significance) - Storage areas should have adequate shelving such that all materials, including food and food items, are maintained at a minimum of 15 cm (6 in.) off the floor on racks, shelves or pallets. Contamination of food from contact with objects, people, pests or chemicals can cause serious illness.
violations.corrective_action: Operator to ensure all food items are placed on racks and shelves which are at least 15 cm (6 in.) off the ground to prevent contamination of food as well as to allow for cleaning.

violations.description: Food premises not maintained in a sanitary condition [s. 17(1)]
violations.observation: Pink biofilm observed inside of ice machine at time of inspection. Ice is a ready-to-eat food that must be kept protected from mcirobial contamination.
violations.corrective_action: Clean the ice machine and ensure that it is cleaned routinely to prevent growth of mould or biofilm.

violations.description: Equipment/utensils/food contact surfaces are not in good working order [s. 16(b)]
violations.observation: Mechanical dish washer has not been repaired since previous inspection. Staff are currently performing manual dish washing.
violations.corrective_action: Have the dish washer serviced as soon as possible. Continue to ensure that dish ware is cleaned and sanitized manually using three-compartment sink method until dish washer is in working order.

violations.observation: Observed containers of margarine and all vegetable shortening past the best before date in the walk-in cooler. Public health significance - Best before dates indicate the potential shelf life of the food products. If food products not stored under appropriate conditions, there is a potential for the growth of spoilage organisms past the best before date.
violations.corrective_action: Staff immediately discarded the food products past the best before date. Operator to follow First in First out method while storing food items and discard the food products past the best before date.

violations.description: Conditions observed that may allow entrance/harbouring/breeding of pests [s. 26(b),(c)]
violations.observation: Gap observed on the bottom right corner of the back door which can allow the entry of pests into the food premises. This can further contaminate the food and lead to foodborne illnesses.
violations.corrective_action: Operator to seal off the gap on the back door completely to eliminate the pest access and entry points.

violations.observation: Observed cartons of milk and buttermilk past the best before date in the walk-in cooler and walk-in freezer. Public health significance - Best before dates indicate the potential shelf life of the food products. If food products not stored under appropriate conditions, there is a potential for the growth of spoilage organisms past the best before date.
violations.corrective_action: Staff immediately discarded the food products past the best before date. Operator to follow First in First out method while storing food items and discard the food products past the best before date.

violations.observation: Potentially hazardous cold foods (cupcakes; milk and cream cartons)  were stored at above 4°C in the cafe. The internal temperature of cupcakes was recorded at 6.5°C and that of milk was recorded at 10°C. The staff mentioned that these food items have been in the respective refrigeration units for more than 2 hours.  Public Health Significance - All potentially hazardous foods must be stored at below 4°C or above 60°C - out of the danger zone to prevent bacterial growth and possibly food borne illness.
violations.corrective_action: The operator voluntarily discarded the cup cakes and the milk cartons. Do not store potentially hazardous cold foods in the refrigeration units that are not able to maintain a temperature of 4°C or less; monitor and adjust the temperatures or have serviced, as required. Operator to maintain temperature logs for all the cold and hot holding units.

violations.observation: Chemical dishwasher was not dispensing chlorine at the time of inspection. Public health significance - dishwasher should be able to effectively dispense sanitizer solution to ensure sanitation of all tools and utensils. Effective dishwashing and sanitization procedures destroy organisms of public health importance that may be present on the utensils and equipment.
violations.corrective_action: Repair and service the dishwasher so it can dispense a chlorine solution between 50 - 100 ppm. Operator to use the three-compartment sink to wash, rinse and sanitize all utensils and equipment until the dishwasher is repaired.

violations.observation: Inadequate sanitizing rinse solution in the 3-compartment sink in the kitchen area. Quats sanitizer detected at 50 ppm. Public Health significance - Quats sanitizer solution for manual dishwashing must provide a minimum concentration of 200 parts per million (ppm) as required to effectively sanitize dishware. Effective sanitization prevents growth of pathogens and reduces the risk of spread of disease causing organisms.
violations.corrective_action: The staff immediately prepared fresh sanitizer solution in the 3-compartment sink. Quats sanitizer concentration measured at 200 ppm. Monitor and log sanitizer concentration regularly so you know when the sanitizer solution needs to be replaced with fresh solution.

violations.observation: Inadequate sanitizing rinse solution detected in the cafe area. Quats sanitizer concentration measured at 50 ppm in the sanitizer bucket. Public Health significance - Food contact surfaces should be cleaned and sanitized frequently using an adequate concentration of sanitizer solution to destroy pathogens that can contaminate food and potentially cause foodborne illness.
violations.corrective_action: The staff immediately prepared fresh solution in the 3-compartment sink and sanitizer buckets were refilled. Quats sanitizer concentration measured at 200 ppm.

violations.observation: Mini fridge in the cafe at 4.9°C and temperature logs are not maintained. Ensure all cold holding units are at 4°C or below to ensure germ growth is limited.
violations.corrective_action: Mini fridge was adjusted to be colder. Operator to maintain temperature logs for the fridge.

violations.observation: Scoops stored in frozen berry bins in freezer and in sugar bin. The handles of the scoops can coss contaminate the food if they are stored together.
violations.corrective_action: Store scoops outside of food containers.

violations.observation: Chemical dishwasher was not dispensing chlorine at the time of inspection. Ensure the dishwasher is dispensing sanitizer to ensure sanitation of all tools and utensils.
violations.corrective_action: Repair and service the dishwasher so it can dispense a chlorine solution between 50 - 200 ppm. Operator to use the three sink dishwashing method to sanitize all utensils and equipment until the dishwasher is repaired.

violations.observation: Sanitation bucket in the cafe area has no detectable levels of QUATs. QUATs sanitizing solutions must be maintained between 200 - 400 ppm. The buckets must be replaced every 2 - 4 hours or more depending on usage.
violations.corrective_action: Implement a system to ensure the sanitizer is replaced every 4 hours at minimum and that it is between 200 - 400 ppm.

violations.observation: Oranges found in the dry storage area appeared to be over ripened and decaying with potential mould growth in some of the produce. Fruit flies were found in the orange's storage bin
violations.corrective_action: Oranges that are potential infested with mould may pose allergy concerns to the public and should not be served. They can also attract pests like fruit flies into the facility. Operator was told to discard the mould infested oranges and to keep the remaining oranges in the refrigerator. Also, to anticipate and purchase the appropriate amount of fruits to prevent over stocking.

violations.observation: Potentially hazardous foods are displayed at above 4°C in 3 line coolers at the buffet area. The line cooler close to the entrance had lunch meat with an internal temperature measured at 8.7°C. The line cooler containing fruits had an internal temperature measured at 7.4°C (melon). The line cooler beside the pizza hot holding machine containing egg salad was measured at 5.2°C for its internal temperature. The operator stated that the food was prepared and kept in the line coolers at 11:00 AM and will be disposed around 3:00 PM
violations.corrective_action: All potentially hazardous foods must be stored at or below 4°C or above 60°C  to minimize growth of pathogens and toxin production which may lead to foodborne illnesses when consumed by the public. Operator was told to use time labelling system to monitor the food moved to the identified line coolers at the buffet area. The operator was instructed to discard the food once it crosses 4 hr mark.

violations.observation: Meat slicer beside the front kitchen area was not cleaned and sanitized properly and it contained the meat residuals attached to it under the hard to clean surfaces
violations.corrective_action: The meat residuals left on the slicer is exposed to room temperature which may lead to growth of pathogens and toxin formation and may cross contaminate the other food products when the slicer is reused. The operator was told to dissemble the meat slicer and clean and sanitize the equipment as per the manufacturer’s guidelines

violations.description: Equipment/utensils/food contact surfaces are not in good working order [s. 16(b)]
violations.observation: 2 damaged lids and one broken grid wall panel were observed to be placed on the rack for clean equipment at the dishwashing area
violations.corrective_action: Use of damaged equipment may expose the food to physical contamination and can cause injury to workers. The operator was told to discard and replace damaged equipment.

violations.description: Permit not posted in a conspicuous location [s. 8(7)]
violations.observation: Permit not posted in a conspicuous location. However,a valid decal which expires in 2026 was seen. (Public Health significance)- A valid operating permit informs the public that the food facility is inspected and is capable of handling and preparing food safely.
violations.corrective_action: Operator was asked to post the permit in a conspicuous location with the decal issued by the health authority.

violations.observation: Inadequate sanitizing rinse temperature. Rinse cycle temperature of the mechanical high temperature dishwasher was recorded at 66.9 degree C and the rinsing cycle was done thrice to ensure accuracy. (Public Health significance) - High Temperature Automatic dish washers must provide a sanitizing rinse at 71 degree C or more to sanitize dishware and ensure that the utensils are free of contamination.
violations.corrective_action: Immediately initiate hand sanitizing providing an adequate concentration of sink and surface sanitizer to sanitize the dish ware until the dishwasher is able to reach at least 71 degree C temperature for final rinse. Have the dishwasher repaired by a qualified technician and monitor and log the rinse temperature regularly.

violations.observation: High-temperature dishwasher showed a maximum of 67 C after several cycles. Daily temperature logs are maintained, but based off of the digital readout on the machine.
violations.corrective_action: Operator is to acquire a dishwasher-safe probe thermometer or thermolabel tape to take daily temperatures for dish washing in the future to ensure that items reach 71 C at the plate surface, as the digital reading may not accurately indicate plate surface temperature of dish ware. Operator is to submit a maintenance request for the machine and perform the final sanitizing step in a separate sink using 100-200 ppm chlorine or 200 ppm quats for at least 2 minutes of contact time until adjustments are made to the machine.

violations.observation: Deli meat vacuum packaged meat reach-in cooler was measured at 8C. note:Facility's temperature log sheet for this unit at 6:00am was measured at 40F (4C)
violations.corrective_action: Ensure this cooler unit is at 4C (40F) or colder. A ticket will be sent to maintenance person to turn this unit colder

violations.observation: Bottle of medication was stored above food prep table area inside of kitchen. All items intended for personal use are to be used and stored outside of the kitchen area.
violations.corrective_action: Bottle of medication was moved outside of the kitchen during inspection.

violations.observation: Food tray inserts were placed directly in front of hand washing sink at start of inspection. To allow for ease of access, food items and equipment should not obstruct hand washing stations. Cross-contamination of food items may also occur if placed near hand washing sinks.

violations.observation:
Walk-in cooler temperatures was measured at 7.5 degrees Celsius in the center portion of the cooler.
Public Health Significance - refrigeration temperatures for perishable foods must be less than 4°C to prevent the growth of disease causing bacteria and toxin production.

violations.observation: Evidence of mice; droppings were noted in the facility. Operator has a pest control operator contract in place. Public Health Significance - Rodents and other pests may cross contaminate foods and surfaces or contaminate human food with feces and urine, carry parasites and other diseases.
violations.corrective_action: Remove any pest attractants such as food and water, eliminate access to the building and routes they use inside. Trap and remove the pests. Clean and sanitize area where droppings are located and monitor situation.

violations.observation: Foods were left uncovered and open to contamination. Mice droppings were observed on potatoes stored downstairs (Public Health significance) - Contamination of food from contact with objects, people, pests or chemicals can cause serious illness.
violations.corrective_action: Dispose of any food that have come into direct contact with, or you suspect have come into contact with, mice and their droppings and urine. Place all food in dry-storage area in sealed pest-proof containers.

violations.observation: Evidence of mice; droppings were noted in the facility. (Public Health Significance) Rodents and other pests may cross contaminate foods and surfaces or contaminate human food with feces and urine, carry parasites and other diseases.
violations.corrective_action: Remove any pest attractants such as food and water, eliminate access to the building and routes they use inside. Trap and remove the pests. Clean and sanitize area where droppings are located and monitor situation.

violations.description: Food premises not maintained in a sanitary condition [s. 17(1)]
violations.observation: Noticeable amount of food debris on floor, as well as clutter downstairs. Public health significance - Clutter can provide harbourage for pests. Food debris can provide nutrients for pests and worsen infestations.
violations.corrective_action: Ensure that the restaurant is kept clean and sanitary. Remove items not required for food preparation from facility, and organize downstairs storage. Provide updated Sanitation plan to Northern Health.

violations.observation: Potentially hazardous cold foods were stored around 8°C in walk-in cooler. (Public Health significance) - All potentially hazardous foods must be stored at below 4°C or above 60°C - out of the danger zone to prevent bacterial growth and possibly food borne illness
violations.corrective_action: Move potentially hazardous cold foods to working refrigeration units that maintain a temperature of 4°C or less, monitor and adjust the temperatures or have serviced, as required. There was significant variability in temperature throughout walk-in cooler (0°C to 8°C), operator may need to reorganize the cooler to ensure adequate airflow.

violations.observation: Foods were left uncovered and open to contamination in walk-in cooler. Raw meat was left uncovered to thaw downstairs (Public Health significance) - Contamination of food from contact with objects, people, pests or chemicals can cause serious illness.
violations.corrective_action: Cover or otherwise protect all foods from airborne contaminants, drips from raw foods, and contact with objects and staff

violations.description: Food not thawed in an acceptable manner [s. 14(2)]
violations.observation:
Improper thawing procedure, meat thawed at room temperature.
(Public Health Significance) Thawing at room temperature is uncontrolled and over the required time, portions of the product can be in the danger zone for extended periods of time.
violations.corrective_action: Thaw foods under running cold water, in the fridge or in the microwave oven.

violations.observation: Evidence of mice; droppings were noted in the facility. Operator was aware and has pest control operator come once a month to check traps. (Public Health Significance) Rodents and other pests may cross contaminate foods and surfaces or contaminate human food with feces and urine, carry parasites and other diseases.
violations.corrective_action: Remove any pest attractants such as food and water, eliminate access to the building and routes they use inside. Continue to trap and remove the pests, as well as monitor the situation. Clean and sanitize area where droppings are located, and throw away any food that may have been contaminated by mice or mice droppings.

violations.observation: Back door was left open; operator claims that mice were coming into facility through holes in basement floor. Pipe was leaking downstairs. Inadequate sanitation within food preparation area also provides food for pests.
violations.corrective_action: Keep back door closed, or install screen if operator wants to keep door open. Plug up holes in basement floor or have screen placed over top if they are used for drainage. Have pipes downstairs repaired.

violations.observation: Back door is left open without a screendoor. This allows pest entry.
violations.corrective_action: Operator to install a screen door.

violations.observation: Potentially hazardous cold foods are stored above 4°C at 10°C in the upstairs walk- in cooler. (Public Health significance) - All potentially hazardous foods must be stored at below 4°C or above 60°C - out of the danger zone to prevent bacterial growth and possibly food borne illness
violations.corrective_action: Move potentially hazardous cold foods to working refrigeration units that maintain a temperature of 4°C or less, monitor and adjust the temperatures or have serviced, as required.

violations.observation: Sanitation plan is unclear and regular sanitation of the facility does not seem the be happening on a regular basis. Sanitizer bottles are not lableed and there are multiple chemicals being used without proper dilution ratios or test strips.
violations.corrective_action: Update sanitation plan and train all employees on how to sanitize surfaces regularly with an appropriately diluted sanitizer solution.

violations.observation: Large build up of food debis, grease, and grime in various areas of the restaurant. This can affect sanitation and attract pests.
violations.corrective_action: Regularly clean and sanitize all food contact surfaces, underneath and behind equipment, and tools and equipment to prevent build up of dirt and debris. Ensure the general facility is cleaned and sanitized before the next follow-up visit.

violations.observation: Mice in trap caught and mice droppings found behind shelves and equipment.
violations.corrective_action: Clean and sanitize the facility regularly. Follow mice dropping clean up instructions attached.

violations.observation: Backdoor was left open for the entirety of the inspection. Pests can enter the building easily when the door is open.
violations.corrective_action: Install a screen door or leave the backdoor closed during operation.

violations.description: Items not required for food premises operation being stored on the premises [s. 18]
violations.observation: Many items unrelated to restaurant operations stored in the downstairs storage area. This is a potential nesting area for pest as the clutter makes it difficult to clean and sanitize.
violations.corrective_action: Remove all items that are unrelated to the operation of the restaurant.

violations.observation: The door to the kitchen was open, which allows pests to enter the food facility.
violations.corrective_action: Provide adequate, leakproof, non-absorbent, vermin-proof, entrances. The operator has ordered a screen door for the back entrance and is waiting for it to be installed. Keep the back door closed until it is installed.

violations.observation: Potentially hazardous cold foods are stored at above 4°C. the walk in cooler was above 4C (Public Health significance) - All potentially hazardous foods must be stored at below 4°C or above 60°C - out of the danger zone to prevent bacterial growth and possibly food borne illness
violations.corrective_action: Move potentially hazardous cold foods to working refrigeration units that maintain a temperature of 4°C or less, monitor and adjust the temperatures or have serviced, as required.

violations.observation: Inappropriate equipment is used as scoops to obtain or move ingredients or product. (Public Health significance) - Scoop handles must be kept free from the product to prevent hand contact and contamination
violations.corrective_action: Use food safe scoops in place of bowls or other containers to transfer ingredients

violations.description: Operator has not provided acceptable written food handling procedures [s. 23]
violations.observation: The facility has not submitted a written food safe plan for all food types provided.
violations.corrective_action: Produce and submit a food safe plan for sous vide, mussels, and risotto for a start to a full food safety plan.

violations.observation: Inadequate sanitizing rinse solution. No sanitizer detected. (Public Health significance) - Automatic dish washers must provide a minimum concentration of 50 parts per million (ppm) as required to effectively sanitize dishware, 100 ppm recommended; Hand washing requires 200 ppm unscented bleach solution.
violations.corrective_action: Immediately initiate hand sanitizing providing a 200 ppm soak for 2 minutes for all dish ware. Have the dishwasher repaired by a qualified technician and monitor and log sanitizer concentration regularly so you know when the unit needs adjustment or repair.

violations.description: Conditions observed that may allow entrance/harbouring/breeding of pests [s. 26(b),(c)]
violations.observation: The rear door was open with screen or method to prevent pests from entering the facility.
violations.corrective_action: Provide adequate, l vermin-proof, seals or doors as needed.

violations.description: Food premises not maintained in a sanitary condition [s. 17(1)]
violations.observation: There was a general build up of debris throughout the facility. Many areas have a greasy build up that is not easy to remove. Some surfaces are wearing and are no longer impervious to moisture or easy to clean.
violations.corrective_action: A deep clean of the facility is required. After a deep clean an assessment of surfaces quality will occur.

violations.observation: Observed waffle irons to be covered with grease. (Public Health Significance) -  Accumulation of grease on food handling equipment such as waffle irons  can result in physical contamination of food. If such contaminated food items are consumed, they may result in adverse health effects.
violations.corrective_action: Operator to ensure that the waffle irons are thoroughly cleaned and sanitized on a frequent basis.

violations.observation: Observed accumulation of grease and grime on food contact surfaces such as shelving, storage counters, behind and on the sides food handling equipment such as the deep fryer. (Public Health Significance) - Accumulation of grease and grime on food contact surfaces and food handling areas can potentially cause contamination of food items by aerosolization.
violations.corrective_action: Operator to ensure that all the hard to reach areas of the food premises are throughly deep cleaned on a routine basis.

violations.description: Food premises not maintained in a sanitary condition [s. 17(1)]
violations.observation: Pipe below the dishwashing sink appeared to be leaking. Significant accumulation of water was also observed near the dishwashing area. (Public Health Significance) - Pooling of water in a food premises may cause physical contamination of food items and food handling equipment. Such contaminated food items if consumed may result in adverse health effects.
violations.corrective_action: Operator to ensure that the dishwashing areas is frequently cleaned so as to avoid pooling of water.

violations.observation: Observed (milk and creamer cartoons) stored beyond their best before dates in the refrigeration unit. (Public Health Significance) - There may result in growth of illness causing pathogens in food items post their best before dates. Consumption of such contaminated food items may result in food-borne illness.
violations.corrective_action: Operator to ensure to periodically monitor the best before dates of food items. Operator voluntarily discarded the food items past their best before dates at the time of inspection.

violations.observation: Observed dairy product (milk jug) and chopped fruits stored above 4°C (temperature more than 7°C) in the  bottom cooler by the coffee station. Potentially hazardous food items such as dairy and chopped fruits when stored in the temperature danger zone (4°C - 60°C) for more than 2 hours can cause growth of illness causing pathogens, such food items if consumed can cause food-borne illness.
violations.corrective_action: Ensure to store potentially hazardous food items (dairy and chopped fruits) outside the temperature danger zone (4°C - 60°C) at all times. Operator was able to store potentially hazardous food items at appropriate temperature at the time of inspection.

violations.observation: Observed several food items in the prep coolers inadequately and improperly covered (Public Health Significance) - Inadequately and improperly covering food items in the prep cooler can cause contamination of the food items by various physical and biological agents, consumption of such contaminated food items may result in adverse health effects and food-borne illness.
violations.corrective_action: Operator to ensure that all food items in the prep coolers are adequately and appropriately covered.

violations.observation: Observed scoops submerged in coleslaw salad in the prep cooler by the fryer (Public Health Significance) -  Food handling equipment such as scoops that are exposed to bare hand contact, can cross-contaminate the food items when they are submered in them. Consumption of such contaninated food items can cause food-borne illness.
violations.corrective_action: Operator to ensure that food handling equipment such as scoops are stored in a manner (handles sticking out) to prevent cross-contamination and potentially food-borne illness.

violations.observation: Observed significant accumuation of grease on the waffle irons (Public Health Significance) - Accumulation of grease on food handling equipment such as a waffle iron may result in physical contamination of food. If such contaminated food items are consumed, they may result in adverse health effects.
violations.corrective_action: Operator to ensure that the waffle irons are frequently cleaned and sanitized.

violations.observation: Observed pooling of oil and food debris on equipment storage counters in the kitchen. Significant accumulation of oil and food debris was also noted behind the fryer. Also observed dust bunnies on the lights above the waffle making area (Public Health Significance) -  Unsanitary conditions caused by accumulation of oil, food debris and dust bunnies in the food premises can cause physial contamination of food. Such contaminated food items if consumed may result in food-borne illness and adverse health effects.
violations.corrective_action: Operator to ensure that the food premises is routinely cleaned and maintained in a sanitary manner.

violations.observation: High temperature dishwasher was unable to meet the temperature mark of 71°C. Temperature was measured for atleast 4 times and the machine was run for more than 10 cycles. Improper sanitization of the dishes may lead to increase in growth of pathogens and toxin production which may lead to food borne illnesses.
violations.corrective_action: Operator has contacted Ecolabs to get the dishwasher fixed and in the mean time operator has set up sanitizer tubs with QUATS sanitizer.

violations.observation: Potentially hazardous cold foods are stored at above 4°C in a line cooler in the kitchen area. The surface temperature of condiments in the top portion of the line cooler was measured at ~16-20°C using an IR thermometer. Internal temperature of cut tomatoes was measured at ~8-10°C using a probe thermometer. In the bottom portion of the line cooler, the surface temperature of potentially hazardous cold foods was measured at ~8-10°C. Internal temperature of potentially hazardous cold foods was measured at ~6°C. (Public Health significance) - All potentially hazardous foods must be stored at below 4°C or above 60°C - out of the danger zone to minimize rapid bacterial growth and possibly food borne illness.
violations.corrective_action: On-site, the operator stored the potentially hazardous cold foods in a ice bath and was planning to move them into a working refrigeration unit that maintain a temperature of 4°C or less. Temperature logs showed that the line cooler was not working. This indicates that potentially hazardous cold foods in the line cooler were maintained at temperatures of >4°C for over 2 hours. Potentially hazardous foods stored at >4°C for over 2 hours must be discarded immediately due to time-temperature abuse. Continue to monitor and adjust the temperatures of the line cooler or have serviced, as required.

violations.description: Frozen potentially hazardous food stored/displayed above -18 °C. [s. 14(3)]
violations.observation: In the back kitchen area, frozen potentially hazardous foods were stored above -18°C (~ -10 to -8°C). The temperature gauge indicated a temperature of ~20°F (~ -7°C).
violations.corrective_action: Move potentially hazardous frozen foods to working freezer units that maintain a temperature of -18°C (-0.4°F) or less, monitor and adjust the temperatures or have serviced, as required.

violations.observation: Missing floor tiles under the deep fryer were causing oil and food debris to accumulate. (Public Health Significance) Tight, durable surfaces are required throughout a food establishment to facilitate proper cleaning, minimize pest attractants, and reduce food contamination concerns.
violations.corrective_action: Repair the missing tiles and maintain a cleaning schedule (refer to sanitation plan) for the floor. Pull out fryers and do a thorough cleaning to remove grease that may build up on the floor. Operator stated that maintenance will service/repair the tiles within one month.

violations.observation: Observed two cream cartons past the best before date in the walkin cooler. Best before dates indicate the potential shelf life of the food products. If food products not stored under appropriate conditions, there is a potential for the growth of spoilage organisms past the best before date.
violations.corrective_action: Operator immediately discarded the food product past the best before date. Operator to follow first in first out method while storing food items and discard the food products past the best before date

violations.observation: The cooked food's temperature isn't monitored, and there are no food thermometers in the kitchen during inspections. The operator relies on visual inspection to ensure thorough cooking, posing a risk to public health.  (Public Health significance) When cooking/reheating potentially hazardous foods,It's essential to reach an internal temperature of at least 74°C for 15 seconds, regardless of the cooking method, to ensure safety. The operator should adhere to their food safety plan to mitigate these risks.
violations.corrective_action: Operator to purchase new probe thermometers and starts using them to check Internal temperature of all cooked foods before serving them to the customers. Operator to ensure the temperature is reached to 74°C for 15 seconds as per the food safety plan.

violations.observation: Two dead mice were seen in the customer seating area and mice droppings were noted throughout the facility, including dry storage area and in the cupboards where utensils are stored. (Public Health Significance) Rodents and other pests may cross contaminate foods and surfaces or contaminate human food with feces and urine, carry parasites and other diseases.

Check traps for mice every day. The use of a professional pest control operator is recommended. Clean and sanitize area where droppings are located and monitor situation.

violations.observation: The QUATs sanitizer bottles in the facility were found without the active sanitizer inside them and the concentration level measured in the spray bottle was at o ppm. Inadequate sanitizer solution may lead to improper sanitisation of the food contact surfaces which in turn may lead to contamination of the other foods being prepared on the same surfaces.
violations.corrective_action: Operator refilled the bottle immediately with bleach solution. Operator to contact Ecolab's and get the QUATs sanitizer dispensing machine fixed. Until then operator will keep using chlorine solution with atleast 100 ppm as a sanitizer. Operator to order test strips for chlorine sanitizer to check for its concentration.
